column2: Fix issue 410 DecryptingPartInputStream could return more data than re
column3: This change buffers data coming from a cipher update call if more data is returned than requested larger than the length passed to the read call and uses the buffer on subsequent read calls until empty I'm not that great with Java so there may be a much more efficient way of doing the array handling but it does work on KK

column2: Fix for Abort Session notification
column3: When user A aborts a secure session with user B clear the keys as before then send a message to user B notifying them that the secure session has been closed Upon receiving the abort session message user B is keys will automatically be cleared and they will be put back into an insecure state Fixes Issue 143

column2: Simpler inclusion of native components support for x86
column3: As far as I know there is no need to package a native library in a jar file you can directly include the so library files in the APK under lib by specifying jniLibs srcDirs 'libs' While I was at it I added support for x86 processors I believe there are at least some x86 Android smartphones out there for development there is an x86 Android emulator which is faster to run on Intel PCs This will generate one APK with all native libraries inside There is also the possibility to use Gradle flavors to create one distinct APK for each architecture I can change the code to do that instead if you want I also fixed some typos which were causing build warnings and updated to the lastest build tools Note I thought you would not like me checking in the binaries so if you want people to be able to build without having the NDK installed as it was the case previously it is still necessary to build and check in the native components in library libs I added steps for that into BUILDING md

column2: Refactor Do not do heavy lifting in UI thread when loading Conversation
column3: This refactors the way we load a conversation Basically it changes two things 1 The conversion Cursor List of MessageRecords happens in the loader i e not in the UI thread This is useful since this includes decrypting the message something that could possibly block the UI thread if it is done on too many messages 2 The new system allows us to append messages to the list of already loaded messages Thus in a second step we can refactor the loader to load only a certain number of messages and re issue a loader request if the user scrolls too far up

column2: Improve the Loading of the Contact List do not block UI thread Add option to not display non Push contacts Fixes 664
column3: Up to now we did the loading of the contact list in a strange way Contacts from the phone is address book were retrieved using a background loader good does not block the UI thread Push Contacts from our database were loaded in onLoadComplete i e in the UI thread blocking it In a perfect world every contact would also be a push contact i e loading the push contacts would take just as much time as loading the normal contacts I rebuilt this so that everything is being loaded in a background thread See commit message for implementation details In the second commit I added an option that should fix 664 hiding of non push users I only did this in one list yet the one where you select someone to open a conversation with If we want this I will modify the other lists especially the select multiple contacts list accordingly

column2: Removed the word at in message details timestamp
column3: Rationale for this PR 1 We currently do not have a safe method which allows to translate and adapt the timestamp format and at string which separates timestamps in the message details la SENT date at time A wrongly translated timestamp currently breaks and crashes TextSecure as discussed in so that it cannot be allowed at the moment 2 The word at was not localized which makes localized non English timestamps looking strange Therefore I propose for the moment until we sanitize translation inputs for the timestamp string to simply drop the at word Dropping at simply avoids the need of translation

column2: Delete leading zero from fragment timestamp
column3: The current timestamp in the ConversationFragment dateFormatter is in AM PM format It would most likely be expected therefore that there would not be a zero padding on the hour for this time This change removes the zero padding from the hour in the dateFormatter so that instead of 09 12 45 pm the representation would now be 9 12 44 pm Format documented here number

column2: Fix receiving utf 8 characters in media push messages
column3: When receiving a media message via push that contains unicode characters e g emoji in the body the unicode characters are shown as This is because the received body is converted to a ISO 8859 1 byte array I changed it to convert it to a utf 8 byte array and set the encoding appropriately Then the unicode characters are received correctly Message with wrong encoding screenshot 2014 04 21 11 49 26 Message with my patch applied screenshot 2014 04 21 11 50 11

column2: Have Message Details better reflect dynamic message information
column3: The current Message Details are ambiguous when displaying details As well noticed that pending messages are being shown as sent in the message details when in fact they have not been 519 which I have been able to reproduce This pull request does the following Distinguishes between sent and received messages Displays whether message is sent pending or failed Replaces 'Sender ' label with 'To ' and 'From ' labels depending on whether message is sent or received Replaces 'Sent Received ' with respective 'Sent' and 'Received ' labels Replaces 'Transport ' label with 'Type ' label Lists recipients of group messages currently listed as 'Unknown' Removed timezone and seconds strings from date time details

column2: Spamfilter
column3: This is a spam filter for TextSecure Messages from filtered senders are marked as read when received and no notification is shown but the message and thread will still exist and appear in the conversation list but it is visually indicated that they are marked as spam Senders can be added removed from the list via the contextual action bar in the conversation list view I agree this could maybe use some refactoring good looking icons management activity but that is only necessary if you are willing to merge this I personally do not need it in my private version I think a feature like this is useful in general so maybe you want to adopt the implementation or the concept

column2: Implementing Quickreply
column3: I have implemented the feature right now the way it works if TextSecure is locked is it will queue the sending of the message until it is unlocked However if the service is killed before that the message will be lost We can avoid this using START REDELIVER INTENT but this gives some slight chance of resending messages if the service is killed between the sending of the message and the stopSelf call I opted to avoid this for now I tried adhering to your code guidelines but this is my first look into this project and frankly I'm not a major Android developer though I think I did alright I avoided duplicating the run tasks when you get the master secret logic in SendReceiveService by extracting it a parent class MasterSecretTaskService Let me know what you think about the way I implemented this Issue 299

column2: Remove translated strings from repository

column2: Add possiblity to store key verification
column3: We currently do not store this anywhere This is needed for any currently discussed UI displaying whether we trust a key is ownership This commit does not include any fancy UI yet Verification is only shown in the key verification activities and in the list of our contact is keys Key verification is done via a MAC over the recipient is ID the key fingerprint some tag The tag is needed to make this MAC different from the isValidKey MAC we currently store

column2: Fix Share Intent behaviour
column3: This commit fixes odd textsecure behavior with share intents when share intents with mime type were handled containing multiple types for example a text and an image the contents were completely ignored and the user saw an empty text field share intents with typ image or other media types would attach the image to the draft correctly but ignored any text that was possibly included This commit changes the behaviour in the following ways the EXTRA TEXT string from the intent is always included the mime type of the Uri passed in EXTRA STREAM is deduced via ContentResolver or File extension depending on the Uri type which makes handling of type intents possible and possibly makes textsecure more robust against wrong intent types This behaviour is the same as in most other apps tested Hangouts several mail apps G and others

column3: Not much to say here The icon looked really unsharp on my new HTC m8 so I added a higher resolution version Also added a little border just like all other icons in android have Changed the name as well because sms did not really fit any more Old icon old New icon new

column2: Switch from classic context menu to ActionBar in the conversation view
column3: Just a replacement following the Holo style guidelines Not implementing multiple selections I believe there is another pull request for the multiple selections version of this but it is not finished yet So maybe just go with this simple version first Here is what it looks like screenshot 2014 03 04 15 52 30

column2: Hide advanced options in their own screen
column3: Hides advanced options in their own sub menu as suggested by here issuecomment 36191045 I did not add an option to enable disable advanced options It seems that just putting them in their own sub screen serves the purpose to me the people who do not want or care about the advanced options can safely ignore them and those who use them wo not have to jump through hoops to get to them Thoughts

column2: use apply for preferences instead of commit
column3: Stops UI thread from blocking when the app decides to change a preference

column2: Add preview of encryption channel in input field hint
column3: Pretty straight forward implementation of is suggestion in 766 Changes the hint text the same time the icon is changed to indicate the channel that will be used to send the text There is some new text to be translated Send an encrypted push message Send an encrypted SMS Send an unencrypted SMS

column2: Add multi message select and delete
column3: As requested in 786 This is my first non trivial work on an Android app I mostly imitated what already existed It will probably require some tuning I ll comment on some specific code where I have questions

column2: fix doublure declaration of android permission WAKE LOCK
column3: android permission WAKE LOCK was delared twice and resulted in a build warning

column2: Add s selected subtitle to Conversation List batch mode
column3: While looking how to implement the action bar in the coversation itself I had a look at how it was done in the conversation list and noticed that the xml there was containing code to show how many items currently are selected but this code was never used Also this can be done simply by mode setTitle and mode setSubtitle no need for a whole xml So I removed the xml and implemented the code Now when more than 1 item is selected the subtitle shows s selected new string to be translated

column2: Send SMS in context menu still sends data message when an attachment is present
column3: I noticed the following behaviour When an image or something else is attached the context menu options still show send unencrypted SMS send encrypted SMS but using either one still sends a TS data message including the attachment I think either those buttons should not be shown after an attachment was added or they should produce some kind of error message telling the user that he should remove the attachment Attached is a quick implementation for the second version This error continues somewhere deeper because the forceSms parameter from ConversationActivity sendMessage 1073 was forwarded to ConversationActivity sendMediaMessage 1097 and then to MessageSender send 56 and then to MmsDatabase insertMessageOutbox 575 and then to actually I lost track there but I do not have a good understanding of the transport mechanisms working there I think someone more experienced should have a look why the forceSms parameter ultimatively still does not prevent the message from being sent as a data message mms maybe There still needs to be a user notification so I think this pull request is fine anyways Alternatively fixing the bug somewhere else and just removing the buttons when an attachment is added would be fine for me as well

column2: Fixes for outgoing SMS MMS direct and fallback behavior
column3: 1 Correct MMS fallback settings 2 Prevent SMS MMS messages from leaking out under certain circumstances when they should not

column2: Fix more leaked service connections
column3: PassphraseRequiredMixin might check for a bound service at a time where the bind has been requested but the service connection has not been established yet and therefore fail to call unbindService leading to a leaked service connection This fixes 1518

column2: Fixes subtitle is not updated when select all is pressed
column3: Mentioned in a54d20f FREEBIE

column2: add custom phone number type
column3: This adds the custom phone number label to the new conversation activity Until now there was just custom displayed instead of the actual custom string This fixes 389 Second PR because I screwed up the first one 1489

column2: Show the time on messages always
column3: Personally I find it better to always show the receive time of a message Event if it was not sent on the same day

column2: Add Bountysource badge to README
column3: Because you have some open bounties we thought you might want to display this badge in your README

column2: Add Travis CI config
column3: Since there was no reaction in 475 for a while I went ahead and had a look at that Travis has added explicit support for Android so the build script is quite simple Listing the components in travis yml is not strictly needed they are installed by default Overview but I thought it might save some time in the future when the defaults are changed I also updated the build tools to the latest version and added a travis build status image will look like Build Status to the readme You can have a look at a successful build at

column2: move FLAG SECURE to PassphraseRequiredMixin
column3: This change applies the presumption that Activities which require a passphrase should also be protected with FLAG SECURE if the user has that option enabled Also takes better advantage of java generics to save an argument Tested on Android 2 3 and 4 4

column2: temporarily disable encrypted backup
column3: pending fixes to the major issues around it Kept import enabled as it seems to magically work for a small handful of people but export disabled to stop people from thinking they are creating stable backups also localize some strings as sugar on top

column2: robolectric testing
column3: UPDATE instead of moving our entire source would be hell for merges and PRs I would imagine I modified the robolectric plugin to allow custom sourceSet specification reliant on We can still go back to moving the source to match what Android expects by default if we would prefer this and using the stock Robolectric plugin instead but this is much more unobtrusive So this was a major pain in the ass because of Android is tools team not wanting to make life easy for testers Unfortunately the robolectric plugin does not appear to support specifying test directories outside of the default android locations so I moved our source folders to match what Android recommends project layouts look like This PR is up for commentary on if this is a good idea or not it may be too painful to justify but this seems to really be the only way to have tests that are TravisCI friendly and do not require us to have a device plugged in The other option is I can submit a PR to the robolectric plugin and we can wait for that to get pulled upstream and roll our own for the time being if we want this in quickly

column3: The Contact keys page does not serve any purpose any more and is causing more turmoil than good

column2: Fixing race condition and other mistakes Fixes 1603
column3: FREEBIE

column2: Replace XML serializer in plaintext export
column3: Fixes 342 Alternative to 929 Preserves all emojis

column2: do not try to load recipients for each filter text
column3: Stops all the entries coming up in the canonical address id and saves CPU time

column2: stop using undocumented broken sqlite function
column3: Verified by running sqlite3 in adb shell that PHONE NUMBERS EQUAL was acting incorrectly in saying phone numbers with different country numbers were equivalent probably among other issues Going back to the safer option of always explicitly comparing E164 numbers Updated libphonenumber to 6 0 the one we were using was about a year old and I saw in the changelog that there were some localization fixes for some countries that we probably want to pull in It should be noted that the first call to canonicalize a number will result in a disk read meaning it could take a couple hundred milliseconds saw 350ms on occasion for first call We can mitigate this by cheating and prime PhoneNumberUtil on a separate thread during the app start create an E164 cache database or bitch at Google until they add an option to preload locale data unlikely Untested with me moving about to different countries but should fix 791

column2: Change Push and SMS settings title to Sending and Receiving
column3: Maybe Fixes 1610 Changed the Push and SMS settings title to Sending and Receiving via the strings in the resource folders Changed the string name and its value in the default folder along with a google translate generated version in each languages respective resource folder

column2: Move default SMS and system import to reminders

column2: add hugo annotation debugging
column3: See for library description Basically you can annotate any method with DebugLog and get input output timing information for free in the logcat of debug builds does not affect release builds includes some annotations on large methods that need asynchro nizing refactoring Ideally we do not have anything running on the main thread that lasts longer than 15ms 60fps padding

column2: Add backspace to emoji drawer two tiny tweaks
column3: Thought this would be useful and someone was even generous enough to leave unused drawables for the purpose Screenshot Also two other small tweaks I personally think it is better without the gray placeholder squares but that is just my opinion man

column2: New encrypted export
column3: switch to xstream for serialization and deserialization use our own custom file format for encrypted backups file format importing flow User types in password of backup decrypts and inserts messages into db and replaces identity key Removes all existing session state data If user is TS registered they will be unregistered and then prompted with registration once again

column2: fix EmojiLRU concurrency exception
column3: Clone the cache before persisting it to avoid writes occurring during serialization causing a ConcurrentModificationException

column2: Add notification extensions for android wear
column3: This adds two things to notifications on Android wear devices currently only for single thread notifications 1 An additional page lists all unread messages with sender and without truncation This only applies if more than one message is unread 2 A reply action to input a message by voice or choose from some predefined answers For the predefined answers I chose the first couple of things that came to mind so discussion is welcome I more or less copy pasted the message sending part from the ConversationActivity maybe this functionality should be refactored into a separate class

column2: Mms fixes
column3: Here is some mms bugfixes Always respect the user overridden mms settings For operators with multiple APNs make sure we try all of them Reconnect if the mms radio connectivity timeouts Respect the proxyIfPossible flag

column2: fix issue 1759
use URLConnection for MMS because it is better
column3: Among other things the code is actually maintained and it can handle things like HTTP redirects Also you do not need to set instance wide proxy settings to pipe a single connection I also added in more verbose logging to follow the code path better for future debug logs

column2: Homescreen widget
column3: I implemented a widget just showing the number of unread messages Please consider for integrating as I miss this feature Eyck

column2: Added the dependency Google Repository
migrate nav panel items to actionbar
column3: It is confusing to have two menus that do not have a strong difference in the item categories let is simplify the codebase and make it easier for users at the same time Resolves 1819

column2: opportunistically use Android is E164 cached numbers
column3: The first call and any calls if libphonenumber decides to clear out its memory cache to canonicalizeNumber takes 700 950ms on my Nexus 5 due to the amount of metadata being read from disk This leads to a pretty noticeable delay when opening a conversation sometimes This is a proposal that benefits devices on Jelly Bean or higher Since API 16 Android provides E164 normalized numbers for any contact that has a number specified and we can take advantage of that

column2: improve some content descriptions
column3: Contact photos did not have a description Send button did not state the type of message that will be sent if clicked Conversations just said TextSecure instead of the saying what the opened conversation is

column2: New APN database
column3: apntool Imports Google provided apns xml file found in Android and Hangouts app Creates a gzipped easily queried legacy friendly SQLite database gradlew q updateApnDatabase to re run and copy over the new asset ApnDatabase Use SQLiteAssetHelper to gunzip from assets and version control the database DB version is set to Google is xml file version for easily tracking when we need to update Lookup MMSC info with the following priorities 1 Try to get relevant MCC MNC from multiple places in order of probability of it being correct 2 If MCC MNC was available also try to get APN name via the MMS NetworkInfo is extraInfo string 3 If no matching MMSCs were found including APN name try without the APN old behavior

column2: prevent another cursor leak
column3: if two queries happen because the first failed to find one with the apn discriminator one cursor is leaked

column2: disable localized collators in ApnDB
Work with servers using the free telephony accounts
column3: Recognize verification code messages that have ads included such as Sent from your Twilio trial account and Nexmo Demo FREEBIE

column2: Remove superfluous repetition
column3: FREEBIE

column2: smil
column3: Use SMIL for all MMS attachments Also increase MMS maximum size to a bit under 300kb chose 280 for some padding as well as allow images to be their recommended max dimension of 1280 As is pretty obvious by the files changed most of the changes are copying in the W3C standard SMIL DOM implementation with some modifications for simplicity Since TextSecure does not attach multiple images in one MMS I was able to simplify the logic found in other messengers much more drastically which is nice The actual code that assembles the SMIL document can be found in SmilUtil

column2: enable more verbose PDU parse logging
column3: To help identify root cause for issues like 1086

column2: allow url client to follow redirects before checking response code
column3: getInputStream is the method that follows redirects so we need to call that first to get to the final URL before checking the status code evidence

column2: fallback to imprecise scaling if low memory
column3: Gracefully falls back to rough scaling to solve the OutOfMemoryErrors that I was able to reproduce on a GB emulator with low RAM This helps a lot since it does not require two large Bitmap objects in memory at the same time Also moved away from BufferedInputStream to another workaround to the Android bitmap problems which will save more memory On top of that we were not closing the streams so that is also fixed

column2: Fix back button behavior for activities started from a notification
column3: This change brings TextSecure closer to the behavior described in 1 However the usage of RoutingActivity makes a slightly different approach necessary With this change RoutingActivity builds a new activity stack once the master secret was retrieved and it is ready to launch ConversationListActivity or ConversationActivity This way pressing the back button when the password prompt is displayed wo not return to another instance of RoutingActivity that would display another password prompt Fixes issue 480

column2: Change actionbar icon
column3: Just a proposal but I think TextSecure looks better with a colorful actionbar icon Gmail Hangouts Whatsapp K 9 and almost every other app I looked at are using a colorfull icon as well light theme before after light dark theme before after dark FREEBIE

column2: Show date and year for ancient 1 year old messages
column3: The timestamp shown for very old messages only includes the time without a date at all Fix it FREEBIE

column2: Animate sent message bubbles WIP
column3: Awful quality preview GIF I'm unsure on what the best way to pass the message ID to the adapter or know what view to animate would be so I'm uploading this for comments and pointers This is also broken in group chats since I do not know how to get the right ID there

column2: do not crash if we can not get an mccmnc
column3: I should not be throwing an uncaught exception when we can not work out a phone is MCC MNC we should just be going up the normal logic chain of not being able to find a matching APN Fixes 1916

column2: custom redirect logic
column3: follow redirects with POSTs every time break on redirect loops trace the redirects in debug log for better diagnosis

column2: primarily performance and correctness lint fixes
column3: This is a long one but it takes care of a decent amount of annoyingness and makes our code more obvious and explicit Also cleaned up unused resources that have been sitting around for quite a while Performance improvements are largely around flattening layouts and minimizing memory leaks correctness about hardcoded strings and explicit annotations for using APIs only available on certain platforms Went from 349 errors and 565 warnings to 2 errors and 62 warnings the two errors will be corrected once translations are imported

column2: Address some lint warnings
column3: Getting my toes wet by addressing some lint warnings from the current master branch build

column2: Lint Address a couple of lint warnings in library
Fix for issue 973 Sharing photos are in wrong format on the Galaxy S3
column3: Orientation information that is stored in the MediaStore is used to rotate the thumbnail and actual image

column2: use https maven central
column3: Apparently it is been available since August gradle

column2: Thread Separator darker
column3: newseperator the seperator was barely visible so I made it darker

column2: MmsCommunication refactor
column3: Introduce MmsConnection class to handle incoming and outgoing network transactions behaving as a simple abstraction layer over URLConnection objects Also another small change for general safety in retry logic check protocol before following links and prohibit https http redirects Cuts down on redundant code and reduces a bit of confusion keeping a majority of the static MMS related methods to fewer classes

column2: add CM APN list remove non MMS APN info
column3: Fixes missing Verizon APN 310 5 causing many failed CDMA MMS sends I also removed all APN rows that did not have MMSCs specified so overall net loss in APK size

column2: switch back to BufferedInputStream
column3: Fixes 1928 Turns out FlushedInputStream mostly does not work at least not as well as BufferedInputStream I was able to reproduce this and this change fixes it It uses more memory but at least it works unlike the other claimed solution

column2: Added Bountysource bounty badge to README
column3: Split contributing code into BitHub and Bountysource subsections since there is a 305 bounty on Bountysource You can also enable GitHub Issues integration from if you would like

column2: actually fallback when mms local params unset
column3: preferences was returning instead of null when unset so things broke when you had manual MMS override checked but did not set the MMSC

column2: sane fallback for media selection on exception
column3: Apparently some KitKat users can not handle the OPEN DOCUMENT intent so we can fallback to the older GET CONTENT one and finally fail much more nicely if neither work

column2: use wildcard media types do not crash on preview fail
column3: Checked some snippets and this seems to be the recommended approach image instead of image jpeg for example Also catching ActivityNotFoundExceptions as recommended showing toast instead of crashing Should resolve 1365

column3: there is an error in line 523 Impoteer should be Importeer

column2: Implement delivery receipts
column3: 1 Support a receipt push message type 2 Identify messages by timestamp 3 Introduce a JobManager to handle the queue for network dependent jobs

column2: Persistent job queue derivative of android priority jobqueue
revert content type generics
column3: I think we should focus our efforts on viewing the media in app and this change seems to do more damage than good Reverting

column2: add PushDownloaderJob
column3: I tried to add a job to download the push attachments to fix 1264 The job is added to the new JobManager in SendReceiveService and should start the PushDownloader Unfortunately it is not working as expected If there is no network connection when the job is added its delayed and the download starts as soon as the connection is established again like it should But if the download fails because the connection is lost during the download the IOException is thrown and the job seems to be deferred but its not started again when the network connection comes back I thought perhaps has an idea why the job is not started again What did I forgot edit I thought the jobManager is from mcginty but its from moxie

column2: Added dark theme to ImportExportActivity
column3: Fixes 1976 Added DynamicTheme to ImportExportActivity to set theme to user preference Probably should also do the same for DynamicLanguage for this activity

column2: extend JobManager TestCase
column3: I added a testcase to the JobManagerTest to test the deferring because of missing requirements I had problems with the JobManager in 2031 It currently fails If I did not misunderstood the JobManager logic it could be fixed by removing the return JobResult DEFERRED in the JobConsumer file

column2: remove deferred jobs from persistent DB before they get added again
column3: I made a mistake in 2033 If a persistent job terminates with JobResult DEFERRED it will be added to the JobManager again But then it would be twice in the persistent database With this patch it gets deleted first from the DB before adding the Job to the JobManager again That feels a bit weird but I did not found an easy way of re adding the job to the queue without writing it to the persistent database Some one has a better solution FREEBIE

column2: In app media previews
column3: MediaPreviewActivity currently only supporting images will be used to show attachments in app in order to avoid the contents being exposed unencrypted Refactored saving attachments logic into a redone SaveAttachmentTask to be used in more than one place

column2: Migrate from ActionBarSherlock to AppCompat
column3: This is necessary for moving forward with Android is common UI components Also it simplifies our multiple PasswordRequiredSherlockActivities as all ActionBarActivity objects support the compat fragment manager This also uses the support v4 preferencefragment library to also include support PreferenceFragment objects since AppCompat fails to include it Most of the changes are namespace replacements

column2: Clear attachments on reselection
column3: as we only show the FIRST attachment per message we also should only send one attachment not sure about sending but code looks as if all attachments gets sent changing for example a video to an image or an audio was also not working as the first attachment persists avoid sending wrong attachments reproduce like this Add text He mom thats me on holiday Add attachment Me on Holly jpg OMG wrong attachment Better change ignoring the delete button Add attachment Me on holiday jpg puh that was close send OMG I would not implement a Do you want to change the attachment button to keep the UX Also I never felt that more than one attachment is going out at once Works with drafts Tested KK but should also work on GB

column2: clear pending slides when attachment reselected
column3: This is just a quick fix for 2012 ignoring that AttachmentManager and SlideDeck need replacement

column2: fix display of JobManager Readme
column3: FREEBIE

column2: Compress emoji pngs to save space
column3: Compression is done using 'optipng preserve o7' and it saved 0 5 MiB FREEBIE

column2: Update barcode library to fix QR code scanning
column3: In the latest master I can not scan QR codes anymore I'm getting this error I guess it is because of our dependency changes and this old bug in the barcode library I removed the old library from the source and added the latest version via maven in the gradle build script I also had to adapt the KeyScanningActivity to the latest version I only tested it on my android 4 4 device can someone test it on a real 2 3 device FREEBIE

column2: add PushDownloaderJob
column3: This fixes 1264 If a pending attachment download is interrupted it will be resumed as soon as the network connection is established again The job is persistent so the download will be resumed after an app restart as well Until now JobManager setEncryptionKeys was never called so encrypted jobs were never loaded to the JobQueue from the database I put the call to setEncryptionKeys in RoutingActivity onNewMasterSecret I'm not sure if this is the best place for it

column2: Missing dependencies in the Wki
column3: I compiled according to the Wiki According to the wiki the compile dependencies are Despite having the dependencies compiling did not work it complained about a missing com google android gms play services I had to install the following additional packages Google Play Services Google Repository Google Play services for Froyo I do not know if all of these were needed but I am sure Google Repository was needed This made the compiler go a lot further It still fails but it is probably be an unrelated issue After doing this the compilation went a bit further but now there is a new error

column2: Textsecure 2 3 0 not visible in Playstore for Galaxy S2 with CM11
column3: Hi although 2 3 0 has been uploaded to Playstore a couple of days ago it is still not visible with my Galaxy S2 with CM11 I can only see 2 2 0 Am I missing something Regards mls

column2: Exception in GcmRefreshJob chrashs TextSecure on start
column3: Since the update to version 2 30 of TextSecure I'm no longer able to start it I'm using a Xperia Arc S with Android Version 4 04 API Level 15 Here the StackTrace java lang RuntimeException Ca not create handler inside thread that has not called Looper prepare at android os Handler init Handler java 121 at android widget Toast TN init Toast 317 at android widget Toast init Toast java 91 at android widget Toast makeText Toast java 233 at org thoughtcrime securesms jobs GcmRefreshJob onRun GcmRefreshJob java 41 at org whispersystems jobqueue JobConsumer runJob JobConsumer java 72 at org whispersystems jobqueue JobConsumer run JobConsumer java 46 I typed in the StackTrace by hand therefore there may be typos But I think the problem gets clear I tried to trace back the exception in the source code and it seemed that the JobConsumer should call Looper prepare but did not do so On the otherhandside I also was not able to find a call to makeText in the GcmRefreshJob and I does not look like everybody got this problem I hope this can be fixed soon Edit As I just found out GcmRefreshJob changed in commit bf19307916568f0d44c28f2c6fb27d88ac48641a from 13 hours ago Maybe this already fixes the problem

column2: Add setting to hide avatars
column3: All of the avatars are the grey default guy for me so I do not want it taking up space I understand that adding settings bad though so if you do not want the feature that is fine It is just something I wanted and a chance for me to start getting familiar with the code If you are interested in merging I need to add a couple of things 1 A listener to refresh the view when the setting is changed Not sure how to do that at the moment but I can work on that 2 The avatar is shown in multiple places e g when you start a new message and enter a number so it should probably be hidden everywhere when the setting is enabled 3 There should probably be a new way to pull up that contact window or something It is not really something I use but there might be people who want to hide the avatar but do want that ability

column2: UI Stack Traces
Clicking on received images crashes TS
column3: This is after the last Android update to 2 31 how can i provide a log Or is this bug already known

column2: fix for ringtone selection with android support v4 preferencefragment
column3: as mentioned in 1635 the ringtone selection is not working with android support v4 preferencefragment This workaround from fixes this issue FREEBIE

column2: More aestethical emoticons
column3: In my opinion the emoticons are really ugly Maybe there is a free emoticon pack out there which is a bit nicer

column2: Support for time base message deletion
column3: It would be nice if the sender can set a timebox that the message will be permanently deleted after that from tall receivers' devices This can be the time after viewing the message or after the arrival of the message even if the message is not viewed Something like spanchat and more

column2: catching failed attachment downloads
column3: AttachmentDownloadJob is just restarting failed jobs if they fail with PushNetworkException Should hopefully finally close 1264 FREEBIE

column2: Google Play Service Update Crash AGAIN
column3: Seriously just like my previous ticket Suddenly without any notice TS 2 3 0 requires a newer Google Play Services to be installed Unlike other apps who warn you of this problem TS just crashes on start if you have the wrong version Why is it so hard to 1 Write it in the changelog 2 Check for the version on app startup and display some sort of dialog like google maps e g 3 Provide support for older versions

column2: Updating the wiki Building from the sources
column3: I would like to update the Prerequisites section of the Wiki because the list is incomplete and compiling fails unless several additional packages which are not mentioned in the wiki are installed via the Android Package Manager However I believe I installed unnecessary packages in addition to the needed ones Before applying the changes to the Wiki I would like to reduce the packages to the minimum needed set Please help me by trimming unneeded fat from the following list Prerequisites Android SDK manager Java Development Kit JDK compiler for example openjdk devel JRE alone is not enough At least version 7 of Java is required The following packages should be installed via the package manager Android Support Repository Android Support Library Android SDK build tools 19 Google Play Services Android 4 4 2 API 19 SDK Platform Android 5 0 API 21 SDK Platform Android 4 4W 2 API 20 SDK Platform Google Repository

column2: Keypress Stack Trace
More UI Stack Traces
Error 2 3 x with old Google Play services
column3: When upgrading from 2 2 0 to 2 3 0 TextSecure crashed and I had to downfgade Installing 2 2 0 over 2 3 0 refused is this a bug somewhere or done deliberately so I had to deinstall 2 3 0 install 2 2 0 and restore my Titanium backup 2 3 2 did work but complained that push mesages did not work anymore because my Google Play Services were too old I upgraded these to the last version but it would have been nice if the message gave more information like the mimimum version required

column2: Ca not end secure session
column3: My Phone verizon moto x latest Textsecure from play store Friend is phone 1gen Moto G iphone 4 My friend broke her phone and put the sim card in another phone that does not have textsecure Now I can receive her messages fine but I can not end my secure session I have to manually send insecure SMS by longpressing send

column2: can not send SMS on 2 3 2
column3: Follwoing an upgrade to TextSecure 2 3 2 I am no longer able to send SMS I write the SMS and press send it stays the dark green with the under the message and never times out I can receive SMS All SMS messages are to from non text secure users alternate messaging apps send out SMS ok edit Device is Samsung Galaxy S4 running Cyanogen Mod 11 M11

column2: Group message name fix
column3: Tried to better conform to code style guidelines and now set it to use strings xml so that translations will work for this Also now merely adds it to the array of group members rather than physically changing the recipient object which in hindsight was a terrible idea Please let me know if I need to do anything more to make the code prettier good enough quality to be merged I toyed with the idea of extrapolating inserting me in a separate private method but I could not think of a way to do that that would not incur an O n time iterating through the entire list of members whereas this method puts in the 'Me' fix while it is generating the list the first time so I figured this would be better

column2: move log submission to new library
column3: outline SubmitLogFragment can be included in any project to report device logs to a hastebin compatible endpoint as specified by the activity Activity must implement the proper interface methods to handle success failure cancel cases Basic data scrubber to remove potentially sensitive info by default todo maven repo and maybe separate git repo should talk about plan for modularizing code more configuration options as needed good for now i think work out how translations will work with subprojects

column2: The Google Repository is needed to build TextSecure

column2: Added l10n for message trimmer
column3: Toast message and progress dialog was English only

column2: stringifying messages in Trimmer java
column3: enabling l10n i18n of Delete old messages messages I found that it was previously not possible to translate these trimming messages here is my patch which enables this

column2: Cleanup of unused strings in strings xml
column3: Inspired by the abandoned strings that were left when killing SMS MMS sending failure toast see 2030 Squished out 3 KB for me should be even more when the translations get cleaned

column2: Add Serbian language to the list
column3: Please merge this after pulling in Serbian translation from Transifex Serbian translation is finished and I will keep it updated Thanks FREEBIE

column2: Added message category to notifications for Android 5 silent mode
column3: Hi I have noticed that textsecure notifications are not treated as messages in Android 5 meaning they wo not show up if you configured silent mode see settings sounds notifications interruptions From what I read from the docs settings the category appropriately should do the trick That said I currently do not have a build environment setup but I would appreciate some feedback on whether this is a good idea or not If you like it I will try to test this on my phone first

column2: Use sms body extra from smsto Intent
column3: When processing a SENDTO intent the stock SMS app also populates the text of the draft from the sms body extra if present while TextSecure does not The fix is trivial and should pose no risks and it brings TextSecure is behaviour more in line with the stock app Intent getStringExtra is documented to return null in case there is no extra of the requested name so no error checking is necessary

column2: Fix notification display order
column3: Messages in notifications were showing in reverse order that is newest on top instead of newest at the bottom making multiple messages hard to read

column2: Validation Editable sent message
column3: Many times sent messages contain spelling errors A validation method could solve this kind of problem for example if a sent message could be revoked deleted from the receiver phone server and it would be editable as a template and then it could be sent again within a 2 minutes time limit

column2: Ca not send receive messages SMS MMS PUSH aka xprivacy problems
column3: After recent TextSecure updates I'm unable to send SMS Logs

column2: show current version number in preferences
column3: The current version number is read from the Manifest and added as text to a section Version in Preferences Screenshots img src img src

column2: Re enable encrypted database export
column3: If I understand correctly the only current option allows for any other app which can access the SD card to read all exported messages in plain text Maybe there was a good reason for the removal of this feature but I could not find it so sorry if my issue is redundant

column3: Added DynamicTheme function to import export to fix bug which displayed white theme in the import export window when black theme was applied elsewhere Should fix issue 1976

column2: TS crashes
column3: I just had TS ask for the password nothing new so far However when I pulled down the Android menu I had the persistent notification saying that TS was unlocked What is up

column2: Retry sending pics as push and NOT MMS
column3: Today I sent a photo to a friend of mine For some reason no reason TextSecure said it could not send it Fine So I clicked on resend aaaaand it sent the photo as an MMS instead of a push message What is funny is that in the settings I allowed outgoing SMSs ONLY to non textsecure users so that is another reason why this should not have happened In Europe we do pay for an MMS and they are usually pretty expensive After all the MMS fixes I wonder how come no one ever fixed this

column2: use Loader when conversation is updated instead of requery
column3: Our adapter for conversations and conversation lists was still doing requeries on content changes which happen on the UI thread This change takes advantage of the Loader paradigm and its built in content observation updating to take that into an AsyncTaskLoader Unfortunately you only get the cursor content observation benefits in the CursorLoader class if you are querying from a Content Provider Since we do not do that for conversations I needed to write our own AsyncTaskLoader helper class for how we fetch cursors While I have not reproduced the major lag others have experienced with large conversations I suspect this has a decent amount to do with it Should help 1941

column2: support mms basic auth
column3: MMS Monster is logs showed this made a difference for sending receiving on some providers so implementing here

column2: media preview fixes
column3: Load Bitmaps asynchronously instead of lag on the main thread for sometimes more than a second oops Never load bitmaps that exceed the device is supported max texture width height This stops crashes when previewing images that are received or sent which exceed these device constants Show an error message in place of the image instead of a Toast giving them chance to hit save before going back

column2: Initial Websockets Implementation
column3: This PR is to give the maintainers an overview of the status of the websockets implementation Most likely things will change like build variants but this should be useful as common grounds

column2: TextSecure plays alert twice
column3: Description TextSecure plays the new message alert twice when the TextSecure app window is active and a new message comes in Steps to replicate 1 Open TextSecure and unlock the database 2 Leave the application active 3 Receive an SMS message 4 Hear alert message played twice with two plays overlapping Workaround Close the TextSecure app or switch to an alternate active window before receiving another SMS Unknown variables Does this apply to only SMS or SMS and MMS

column2: Menu Button Missing
column3: Hi Guys first of all you have done an awesome job I have just one issue over here Neither in the main app view nor in the conversation views the menu button shows up I tried restarting the app and the phone Btw I did not know that this button should be in the corner on the top right until a colleague showed me that I could have been able to attach pictures from within the app if the button would have been there Phone details HTC One S Android Version 4 1 2 Please let me know if you need additional info Screenshot

column2: no audio alert when locked

column2: Send via secure SMS if no Internet connection
column3: Hello My problem is if i send a message via Push it works great but if I have no Internet connection the message did not get sent In earlier version it worked I do not use Xprivacy and TS has all rights Now I solve it that a hold the send button and switch to send via secure SMS but I would prefer when this happens automatically when I have no Internet connection TS version 2 3 2 Best regards rene

column2: Ignore groupinstance notifications for T time
column3: It would be really nice to have the option to ignore group notifications for specific groups Not having this feature is really stopping me from using groups in TS because I do not want to get 100 notifications a minute I do not care about at that moment but I also do not want to kill the notifications completely because somebody might want to contact me personally

column2: TS tries sending image via MMS instead of PUSH and failes
column3: I have disabled MMS and SMS in the TS settings I have only PUSH contacts When i send text all is fine When i want to send an image text First try failes Send Error Detail Transport MMS and time info Second time message works Detail Transport PUSH and time info LOG with failed try Android 4 3 Galaxy Nexus Perhaps related to 2162

column2: Laggy keyboard on Lollipop
column3: Nexus 5 Android 5 0 LRX21O TextSecure 2 3 0 default keyboard settings Performance is fine when the device first boots but degrades quickly and input becomes noticeably delayed RAM usage climbs as well currently it is at 272MB with 16 5 hours of uptime This only affects the keyboard in landscape mode I only have a few dozen threads with no more than a handful of messages in each This problem is also experienced by a friend who has a Nexus 5

column2: Make re registration of same phone number more userfriendly
column3: When reinstalling TextSecure or switching the SIM card to another phone PUSH service registration often fails because the number is already registered This forces the user to go to and unregister manually Average users do not know that they have to unregister first They even do not know the above mentioned page And that GCM eventually notifies the server about unregistration seems unreliable due to the fact that many users really have trouble with this issue and are unable to proceed using TextSecure just wondering if similar steps are necessary when web sockets come in I propose to let the registration process check if the number is already registered and automatically perform the necessary steps to unregister and re register the number When I understand the unregister web page correctly this is authenticated by receiving an SMS or call I think this is possible when using the same SIM card phone number This would greatly enhance the usability

column2: Black Screen with Android 5 0 1

column2: Optional revoke
column3: Optional message revoke setting 0 30 sec waiting time before sending a message revoke button

column2: Allow setting status message for yourself and group chats
column3: I have searched through all issues and was wondering i could not find this issue neither open nor closed The idea is to have a status message with text and or emojis for yourself and group chats The problem for this ER is to display the message because at the moment there is no space for it If we look at e g Whatsapp you can see the status in the chat overview and in a contacts view Currently you can see the last message in the chat overview I would rather like to see the status message of a user there instead So I think it would be a smaller problem to achieve this To have a status message in the contacts view is a tougher job because there is no contacts view yet What we have now is the stock android contacts view you get after clicking on the contacts avatar in the overview So this would be an entirely new view Maybe this should be a new issue also An own contacts view would be a nice improvement because we could add other little informations there I think this little nice improvement would make it more fun to use TS

column2: Some push messages are not being delivered
column3: Since Nov 25 so shorty after the 2 3 release some push notifications are not delivered The messages were send without error on both cellular and wifi but they never made it to the reciver 2 3 of the messages send did however get to the reciever without delay or other issues This might be related to issue 2198 I'm currently using TS 2 3 3 on a Moto G with Android 4 4 4 and the issue has been arround since 2 3 Thanks a lot for TS I hope this can be fixed soon

column2: Add a Gitter chat badge to README md
column3: WhisperSystems TextSecure now has a Chat Room on Gitter has just created a chat room You can visit it here This pull request adds this badge to your README md Gitter Chat svg Happy chatting PS Click here if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull requests from Gitter in future

column2: UX Open Keyboard When NewConversationActivity opened
column3: This is a very small PR which fixes a minor UX issue that was annoying me In short it opens the on screen keyboard automatically when you hit the New Message button at the top of the screen I feel that this is advantageous as it removes some friction with the UX for those who are wanting to send a message to someone not already near the top of their conversation list You no longer have to press the text field at the top of the screen to activate the keyboard but can still hide it Thoughts

column2: Regroup preferences
column3: I regrouped the preferences like discussed in the mailing list I put notifications old message deletion and passphrase into their own category pages This is saving us ten items in the preference list Its looking like this now settings red notifications But I dont know how to add the back arrow in the red square to the new PreferenceScreen is Do you know how to put it there And I'm not sure about the new category for the PreferenceScreen is I put them in Miscellaneous now but perhaps you have a better idea

column2: Basic support for direct attachment Feature 520
column3: This provides support as asked in However as mentioned in my comment the picture taking mechanism could introduce a privacy leak as the image captured is stored on sd

column2: Add k 9 style avatars
column3: This adds the generated avatars as discussed at length in 1027 This fixes 969

column2: Added L10n for notification and on first unlock activity
column3: RoutingActivity now uses DynamicLanguage This is needed to set the locale for the first unlock activity which uses the system locale up to now by adding DynamicLanguage to RoutingActivity and by adding refreshNotification that is called when the locale gets changed the notification is always shown in the chosen language discussion is welcome

column2: Show a indicator for a sms in conversation item
column3: Precondition 1 Push and SMS are possible with a conversation partner 2 Data and normal connection is active 3 Receive a message 4 Answer is made through a whisper message Problem The answer is not deliverd until the conversation partner is also online So we both wonder why there is no ongoing message The received message was a sms so I have to look into the details to know this Proposed solution Add a sms indicator to the received message I suggest a indicator for a received sms because it makes a special answer necessary during being online Discussion welcome

column2: Add Custom Vibrate Patterns to Settings
column3: I added the ability to choose custom vibrate Patterns This fixes issue 230 You can chose between default 2x short 2x long 3x short 3x long custom you can specify off time on time Of course I'm open to different standard vibrate patters or other changes This is my first pull request and I'm quite new to Java and Android so please be gentle

column2: Fix group picture disappearing when updating a group
column3: Fixed 1147 Moved hardcoded strings show Progress UI when updating a group

column2: Outgoing MMS preference
column3: Alternative implementation for 1374 Closes 769 ul li Add outgoing MMS preference similar to the one for SMS li li Change default preference to ask before sending SMS MMS li li Add do not ask again Checkbox to Fallback confirmation dialog li li Bugfix You were able to send SMS to non Textsecure users if you enable SMS Fallback but disable SMS to non Textsecure users li ul

column2: Show unread message count on application logo for TouchWiz and other ROMs
column3: Requested in Related to 1526 1136 321 Uses library

column2: Support unread count badge in Nova Launcher Widgetlocker using TeslaUnread API
column3: This pull request adds support for updating the unread badge in Tesla apps Nova Launcher Prime and WidgetLocker using the TeslaUnreadAPI I really like seeing the number of unread messages next to my icons I'm just a user I have no affiliation with TeslaCoil Software Here is what it looks like Nova Launcher Prime image I have added an option to enable disable this feature for the paranoid people and it is off by default but I do not mind if that does not get merged to avoid adding yet another option all the option related code is isolated in the 2nd commit Judging by what it says on the TeslaUnreadAPI page about the security of the unread notification count update it sounds like this API is more secure than broadcast based alternatives so maybe it is acceptable to just issue the notification in case the TeslaUnread app is there I have been using testing this for a few weeks now and have not hit any issues Technically that is with just the first commit but the 2nd one just adds the checkbox and an if statement around the main logic so I think the code is sane

column2: Adding widget with notification count
column3: This adds a widget that looks and behaves just like the TS launcher icon but will have a badge with the number of unread messages on it Tihs closes 321

column2: Add privacy mode for notifications

column2: Enabled audio and video drafts
column3: All slide types do have an image therefore we need to switch the check order Otherwise addAttachmentImage is called and throws ConversationActivity sorry there was an error setting your attachment as the draftType is marked as IMAGE though there is none In that case the audio or video draft gets deleted

column2: Adding TimeDeltaPreference
column3: This adds a TimeDeltaPreference as suggested by in 1623 and makes it the preference for the passphrase timeout That gets rid of one preference It uses the betterpickers library he suggested over there Basically the preference will optionally first launch a dialog to ask whether to enable to disable the timeout and then if enable was chosen launch the time picker Disable is then encoded as 0 This looks like a huge change but it is not I had to move everything from the PreferenceActivity to a Support PreferenceFragment for this string of reasons Problem The pickers library needs a SupportFragmentManager but the PreferencesActivity does not supply this Solution Move everything to a PreferencesFragment and attach it to a very simple FragmentActivity that gives us a SupportFragmentManager Problem PreferencesFragment is only available in API level 11 and not part of the support library Solution Use an external maven artifact supplying us with a SupportPreferencesFragment I hope that this can later also be used for the renotification interval preference in 1623

column2: Fix user facing helping term 'insecure' to 'unsecured'
column3: 'Insecure' implies an uncertainty of intention or confidence Unsecured is more specifically addressing the protocol which wraps the message delivered This struck me immediately while feeling particularly vulnerable and texting someone with whom I experienced real life drama and I'm guessing this applies to many 'personal' text messages Related to 1337 but the term 'unsecured' was never brought up

column2: Changes filtered conversation thread database query to account for group
column3: s Fixes 1954 I go into discussion on this fix and an alternative in some depth in the issues ticket I have tested this fix on Motorola Atrix 2 running 4 0 4 verified first that searching does not show groups and then that after this fix they show up in a search The crux of this is bug is that the thread db search uses an equals operator to query and individual recipientIds are a substring in the case of a group recipientId for which equals does not match

column2: Reset query string when search is collapsed
column3: At the moment when you search in the conversation list and then tap back either on your phone is buttons or in the action bar the filter stays active Only way to reset the filter is to search again and input the empty string

column2: Added l10n for message details
column3: This was already in PR 1309 that was closed by the author Added the 4 missing strings for translation There are indeed languages that do not use the words SMS and MMS Removed toUpperCase to leave this up to the translators I tended to move SMS MMS and PUSH at top of strings xml as these are some main strings but ConversationFragment is the only place they are used standing alone

column2: streaming media internally
column3: Rebased and slightly modified version of moxie is media branch version This one keeps the PartProvider around to supply encrypted previews for audio video and we can remove it once we support previewing all media in app Except in the case of building the MMS body we no longer hold entire media parts in memory with this change This is the first step toward supporting large attachments

column2: Change creation of drafts to onStop method
column3: Drafts were created only on destroy of the conversation activity Moved it to be on stop for the activity

column2: Indicator for transport of incoming messages
column3: Often I have received messages from other TextSecure users who have switched to SMS as they are on the move or similarly they have lost phone network signal and can ONLY use push Currently the only way in which to see the type of the incoming message is via viewing a single message is detail If the transport changes often this in impractical but can be vital in understanding the chances of your own messages getting through I have implemented partly to familiarize myself with the TextSecure code base a solution which allows a user to decide how they would like this information to be displayed if at all There is a new preference with 3 options 2014 06 27 19 23 31 The default option None is to leave it as it currently is with no indication These are what the other two options look like 2014 06 27 19 23 41 2014 06 27 19 23 51 2014 06 27 19 24 04 I'm not sure on the language used in the preferences This could probably be improved

column2: Add message protocol colors to received messages
column3: FREEBIE img 20141008 004429 Sorry for just barging in with this one Any feedback is appreciated I tried to keep it subtle I often find myself checking for the protocol the other person uses so I can answer them on the appropriate channel Mostly this is when they have their mobile internet turned off for various reasons e g limited data plan roaming battery life concerns

column2: Messages not directly delivered when recipient has TextSecure but data connection disabled
column3: A friend has TextSecure but deactivates the data connection oftentimes during the day Since I can t tell when it s active or not on their side and I m too lazy I forget I always send via data This results in the messages not being delivered until said friend activates the data connection again even though they have normal cell connection so a text would go through I m pretty sure this is a known problem but I couldn t find an existing issue for it Also not sure if it s possible to solve or an underlying architectural problem I was thinking something like If the push message isn t delivered in 10 minutes automatically re send it via text and delete the push message from the queue If that s possible

column3: Hello I am unable to attach photos and other files from my external SD card to messages When I select Add attachment in a message thread the file browser only shows the entries Recent Downloads and Internal Storage lacking the SD card as well as say the Gallery app but that s of no importance to me regardless of whether I want to send a picture video or sound see picture The SD card is a 64 GB Samsung made card of the EVO series Sending files from my old 8 GB SD card worked and works just fine However all the other apps I ve tried accessing the new card with Gallery Total Commander PPSSPP see read from and write to it without a problem It might be an issue with the file picker but I couldn t find another app that uses the same one as TextSecure My device is a European Samsung Galaxy Note 3 I m running Android 4 4 2 which I have rooted but I ve found nothing pertaining to this in XPrivacy s settings screenshot 2014 12 20 01 26 47

column2: no way to differ between authenticated unauthenticated contacts
column3: AFAICS textsecure uses some Kex based on DH which is effectively anonymous When I add a new contact it immediately sells me the conversation as being secure even when no fingerprint exchange or something like that has happened This basically makes the whole app and idea of encryption useless as anyone could MitM and I would not notice which is made even worse by the fact that I cannot even mark such contacts which I have manually verified to be verified as it is e g known from OTR Actually I would prefer an option that I can reject any contacts which I have not verified

column2: Do not rely on SMS delivery reports
column3: According to we spoke in the Freenode channel TextSecure uses SMS delivery reports rather than issuing them itself This allows a malicious service provider or depending on exactly how secure SMS is anyone that happens to be nearby the recipient to withhold drop a message that was sent via SMS while issuing a successful delivery report potentially resulting in heated debates issuecomment 55861645 over messages that never actually arrived To prevent this TextSecure should issue its own signed delivery reports

column2: add to blank avatar to clarify that you can add to contacts
column3: After setting up a couple of people with TextSecure we were all stumped that TextSecure did not have a way to add a new phone number to a Contact We tried everything we can think of and no luck So I decided to file a bug report and found 822 then explored a bit more and found that you can add an unknown number as a contact by clicking the blank avatar icon This was not intuitive but I think it can be greatly improved by a simple fix add a to the blank avatar icon if clicking it will trigger the add to contacts sequence

column2: CM v OEM TextSecure Issues
column3: CONDITIONS TextSecure installed on duplicate devices Galaxy S4 One is stock OEM AOSP 4 4 2 the other Cyanogenmod CM11 SnapshotM12 AOSP 4 4 4 CM unit has WhisperPush and TextSecure App WhisperPush not in use TextSecure has been successfully registered on both devices Both units using cellular wifi disabled When CM user sends text to OEM user message is transmitted and received successfully When OEM user replies or initiates message transmission is successful but CM user does not receive unless reboot with WiFi enabled

column2: Avoid multiple drafts when creating a draft from an intent

column2: Cannot send SMS to phone numbers containing sign
column3: Using Android 4 4 4 Textsecure 2 3 3 on Motorola XT1032 Textsecure was installed from Google Play Store When I configure Textsecure as standard SMS app and deactivate the internet connections Textsecure should send messages as SMS also to Textsecure contacts This does not work for one phone number of my address book it says error sending message both for encrypted and unencrypted SMS The phone number contained a plus sign 49 When I replaced it by 0049 it worked so I think the cause for the error message is the sign The phone number is also valid with the plus sign so Textsecure should be able to cope with it

column2: can not connect to push server
column3: I have just reinstalled TextSecure and as I try to register it says that it can not connect to the push server What is the problem Does TextSecure relies on Google Services If yes why does it need it I have disabled some built in apps but Google Services are enabled

column2: Notify local user when remote user is Axolotl message keys are expected to have be deleted based on timeout
column3: Several times now I have sent a friend a message only to have them tell me out of band that they received it but could not read it All of these occasions happened when we did not communicate for several days I'm guessing that the undecryptable behaviour is intentional due to Axolotl deleting unused message keys after a timeout to prevent an attack where the adversary withholds ciphertext in the hope of recovering the recipient device later If my diagnosis is correct please add some sort of UI indication on the sending side that this may be taking place Currently the absence of delivery failed suggests to me they received it and decrypted it when only the former is true and the latter is false

column2: replace unlocalized 'at' in message details date
column3: with a dash Making this a string resource has the potential for crashes Leaving it out completely is a little confusing The dash is the perfect solution until a better date formatter is used

column2: Fix everlasting media drafts
column3: Due to the changes in 1985 the draft gets recreated right after the attachment dialog returns the new attachment Therefor the attachment of the draft wont change

column2: Section on export controls in README md is wrong
column3: The section on export controls in README md is wrong For one thing ENC and TSU are two different Export Exceptions The way it works for publicly available encryption source code is there is a section in the TSU exception that allows export providing that notification of the location of the source is sent to NSA and BIS using email

column2: Desktop client
column3: I know this is a huge feature request and my intention is to begin the discussion I have just started using TextSecure as a secure replacement for Google Hangouts I use Hangouts both on my Android phone and on the desktop so that I can switch to a full size keyboard when I am at home or work This is a great feature that I would love to see implemented by a secure messaging system My suspicion is that multiple clients acting as the same identity and hence all being able to read the same chat history and send messages is either impossible or very difficult to achieve in a client side encryption model Is this true Do you have any intention to support such a feature in the short or long term

column2: bad encrypted message once again

column2: Unable to send SMS over WiFi Republic Wireless
column3: Version 2 3 3 Motorola Moto X2 android 4 4 4 on Republic Wireless If you are not familiar RW uses a baked in VOIP app to allow normally cell based functions like calls and SMS to go over wifi While on wifi only Textsecure will receive SMS normally It will not send SMS secure or plain It does however send secure Push Messages to other Textsecure users with no issue Stock Messenger app will send both SMS and MMS over wifi no problem

column2: remove pointless Bitmap allocation for ImageSlides
column3: The MMS send job sets the data as necessary so this is unused and causing unnecessary memory contention

column2: Add batch mode to contextual action bar
column3: Follow up to 1008 CAB Contextual Action Bar The implementation works only on API 11 so I left the old CAB for API 9 10 If only one item is selected the new CAB works exactly as the old one did As soon as a second item is tapped all menu items but delete get removed hidden and the title is set to batch mode with a subtitle telling how many items are currently selected The delete action works exactly like the deletion of conversations in the ConversationListFragment which means it uses an AsyncTask In fact I took the code for most of the multiple delete method from there so credits to whoever implemented this When the selected items are reduced to one the classic CAB is shown again cab

column2: Support for multi select in the conversation list
column3: Unfortunately I'm pretty sure this is the only way to do multi select on both Honeycomb It would be nice if we could use the new stuff they were experimenting with in 1601 but I do not think it will be backwards compatible

column2: Message selection is unreliable for non plaitext messages
column3: Not sure if this is a regression of the latest release but I just noticed this behaviour on my Samsung SIII GT I9300 and wife is GT I9305 both with stock Android 4 3 both with latest TextSecure When looking at a contact is thread long pressing on messages that include a photo or a number that has been auto recognized by Android therefore underlined does not work as expected Such messages cannot be selected they will not be highlighted even though the info delete copy and forward buttons will show up Performing any action on them like copy or forward makes it obvious when pasting or sending the forwarded message that a different message has actually been copied to the clipboard Example I long press on msg number 10 in a thread click the copy icon then paste in the text input area and a different message usually 11 or 14 is pasted The same effect is seen with copy paste forward and message deletion To test whether you are affected by this bug 1 Find a TextSecure message that meets the above criteria has underlined numbers or a photo 2 Long press to select it 3 Tap the copy icon 4 Long press in the message composition area 5 Tap paste If a different message or nothing is pasted you are bitten by the bug

column3: We are using a group chat with 9 members A B C H I I'm running TextSecure 2 3 3 The following happens when I try to send a message inside our group I do see the small tick underneath the message no blue or green background I receive a warning that there was an error while sending the message green background red triangle the tick disappears I receive a message telling me that there are changed but unknown identity information I can tap on the message the message is replaced with a key Nevertheless everyone in the group receives my message The same problem exists for at least two more users B and C but interesteringly not for everyone Another problem is that I do not receive any messages from user D but everyone else does including B and C There are also some users who do not have any problems at all There are no problems if I send a direct message to any of our group members The messages are encrypted and sent blue background everything seems to be fine You can find a complete log over here

column2: Possible Denial of Service via Federated Server
column3: Cyanogmod WhisperPush is currently holding my account hostage It will not allow me to unregister and therefore I am not able to register with TextSecure I also am not able to use WhisperPush as the phone I registered with was wiped and sold WhisperPush is registration seems to be broken server side and they do not seem to be responsive While I agree that this is Cyanogemod is issue I do see this as a design flaw of TextSecure as you could create a DOS for users There seem to be a fair amount of people having this issue See the following I apologize if this is a proper issue I just wanted to start some discussion around it

column2: Message delivery unreliable
column3: Currently message delivery is unreliable It often happens that I send a message to someone but do not get a message receipt check mark icon Messages sent later get a receipt When I talk to the person a few hours later they tell me they did not receive the message This issue is not limited to me sending but also happens the other way around It also happens for other people as I have been told It also happens for the message receipts themselves sometimes a message arrives on my phone but the sender never receives the receipt The CyanogenMod integrated WhisperPush service is not involved The issue happens between stock Android users as well as with CyanogenMod users From reading other issues I understand that GCM does not offer reliable delivery I wonder if the equivalent of XEP 0198 section 4 Acks acking could be implemented on top of it in TextSecure

column2: Show if other person is typing
column3: In my opinion it would be a great enhancement to see if the other person is typing at the moment If I write long texts for example and click on send but keep writing to send another message I often get interrupted because the other person does not know that some more messages will follow Would there be any chance to add something like xy is typing WhatsApp or some Hangouts Or do you think there is no need for it Of course if possible you should be able to disable this feature if you think it invades your privacy What do you guys think

column2: Feature Request Auto Forward SMS
column3: I have a couple androids floating about and I travel a lot I was looking to setup some automatic forwarding of SMS so that friends of mine who are silly and do not use this great service can contact my local number still and it will be forwarded out of the country to my other number via the text secure protocol Warning setting a cap on the number of messages per unit time or something similar may be wise do not want people to abuse flood DDOS and bring down the service
