column2: Generally poor audio quality and high latency with Signal calls
column3: Latency Perhaps the most notable difference between making a Signal and a standard cell phone call is the latency encountered In fact it was the very first comment one of my friends mentioned when we initiated the call RTT appears to be at least 1 second even when the person I'm calling is relatively close several hundred miles on the East cost of the US where Signal has a server can not find the link now but Moxie published a blog post indicating where Signal has servers for routing calls However when I call the same person on Jitsi the RTT is below 100 ms and latency is barely noticeable We are both connecting via Wifi using broadband connections with at least 50 Mbit down and 10 Mbit of upload capacity for him and 100 100 for me Fiber on my end cable on his Jitsi shows effectively 0 packet loss and sub 5ms jitter with RTT typically around 50 ms Thus I would not expect significant latency in Signal given our geographic proximity and high speed relatively low latency connections In fact my Signal calls to the US from China seemed to have similar latency to the East Cost East Coast US calls Audio Quality The audio quality in Signal appears to generally be worse than a cell phone call and is significantly worse than Jitsi or Skype both of which use wideband codecs SILK for Skype IIRC and Opus 48 Khz for Jitsi In addition I notice more cut outs and audio distortions with Signal Again both callers are on Wifi with high speed broadband connections and are in relatively close physical proximity I would imagine that implementing Opus in Signal would improve call quality generally particularly if it is allowed to run in a wideband setting as Opus is superior to Speex at all bitrates sampling rates per the documentation However I'm rather perplexed about the subjectively high latency Note Was not sure whether to post this here or on the mailing list Please advise

column2: Improve generated contact photos with emoji names
column3: This is a re submission of pull 3617 as this code should be more readable Issue This commit fixes Issue 3604 Contact names which begin with emoji characters cause their generated photo to consist of the question mark in a box UTF 8 character This commit fixes the issue by using a new function to strip out any non language not just English characters from their contact name and instead use the first character of the returned string as their contact photo initial Basic Documentation String getCharacter String name String name is the name of the contact that requires their photo to be generated This function will return the first character of their name that should be suitable for use in the generated contact photo Any whitespace emojis or non language characters should be removed from their name and leave only characters suitable for display in their contact photo

column2: Image corruption when using direct capture
column3: Whenever attempting to use the direct capture feature after taking the picture it shows up in the draft view and in the sent picture as noise Whatever is going on is deterministic as visually similar scenes create visually similar corrupted pictures and visually different scenes create visually different images This is the draft of a picture of a grey wall garbage draft This is after it is sent to myself though this happens to any recipient garbage sent The loading wheel of death is also probably a bug but unrelated and only happens when sending to myself so not really a major concern The actual picture it sends textsecure 2015 07 21 225416 which is obviously a correctly formatted jpeg it is the content that is wrong Happens on TextSecure 2 23 and 2 23 1 I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S II running Cyanogenmod 11 which is Android 4 4 Sending photos via attachment both selecting a picture and the Take Photo feature works fine

column3: A lot of translatable messages have linebreaks that seem unnecessary As just a few examples registration progress activity your device needs network connectivity registration progress activity no network connectivity registration progress activity waiting for sms verification registration activity your country code and phone number There are dozens of others Are these linebreaks actually useful for how the app runs or are they there just to keep the line lengths in res values strings xml under a certain limit If it is the latter then maybe they should be removed because when translating in Transifex they appear in a rather weird way and the Transifex interface sometimes complains that they are not translated correctly even when it appears completely artificial

column2: Saved attachments with contentType image jpg named with attach extension
column3: In SaveAttachmentTask java the call to mimeTypeMap getExtensionFromMimeType contentType with the type image jpg returns null on devices with the AOSP version of MimeUtils java This is because the Android platform does not recognize image jpg as a valid MIME type With the image jpeg type however an extension is returned as expected MimeUtils java android 6 0 0 r5 luni src main java libcore net MimeUtils java AOSP I have dealt with issues in the past where device manufacturers have edited this map love you Samsung which may result in sending devices using content types which receiving devices cannot look up via getExtensionFromMimeType Where to put a sanitizer might be a bit tricky I will dig deeper tomorrow

column2: Suddenly Lost Registration
column3: After I sent an encrypted message to my only signal using contact this morning who for some reason sometimes sends me encrypted texts and sometimes unencrypted Signal suddenly began the registration process again I received a message before it finished and my reply was sent unencrypted After exchanging a couple unencrypted messages clicking the button that appeared up top to enable encrypted functionality and seeing the registration window again I generated a debug log My device and app version are listed there Device samsung SGH T399 gardaltetmo Android 4 2 2 T399UVUAOH2 JDQ39 T399UVUAOH2 App Signal 3 5 2 After three attempts to register I had successfully registered again The first two were interrupted by incoming messages or my attempt to generate a bug report During this time I successfully received an unencrypted MMS from my contact This was the first time I had successfully received an MMS on this phone this was also my first signal mms Earlier I was using smssecure and my mms images just showed as trying to contact server Signal would not complete registration until I would uninstalled smssecure I asked my contact to generate a debug log Here it is My preferences Receive all SMS all MMS SMS delivery reports on Wifi Calling disabled Notifications enabled default ringtone vibrate on LED blue LED blink normal in thread notifications enabled never repeat alerts display name and message in notifications passphrase disabled screenshots blocked no blocked contacts dark theme media auto download only when using wifi my phone is on wifi now do not delete old messages no linked devices signal messages and calls enabled enter key does not send do not use system emoji

column2: Play store description is not translatable
column3: Hi I could not find where can translate the description of the app for Play store For example if the app is viewed in the Play store in Hebrew then the short description is shown in machine translation which is incorrect and makes it hardly possible to understand what the app is because it auto translates the word Signal to a Hebrew word that is unrelated to the actual app is name and makes several grammatical mistakes That is how machine translations usually are The long description with a list of features is shown in English without any translation The solution is to let the translators at Transifex translate these descriptions That is how it is done for the Wikipedia app for example and it works well

column2: Allow setting status messages availability
column3: I m surprised this is not built in and that I could not even find an issue for this This is of course not about being online which makes no sense for mobile devices anyway The goal is to be able to tell people e g the ones you love if you re currently available to be called or e g sleeping or don t want to be disturbed ICQ set the bar high on that back in the days And the only improvement since then was the ability to write custom status messages Although this has been misimplemented sometimes by leaving away the generic status like DND or N A requiring the other side to read the status message and making it impossible to automatically sort the contact list by the availability E g to see who s currently awake and maybe willing to go out It also probably is very easy to implement 1 Implement special status packets messages containing an Enum Int for the generic status and a String for the status message text 2 Allow setting a only locally stored status by tapping the Signal icon in the contact list and choosing an option from the appearing dropdown Classic Away N A Busy DnD and modern Sleeping At Home At Work Outside No Status and maybe At GPS are a good basic set The last option should always be Add new status and open a dialog to set the generic status which picks the icon too and type in a custom status message 3 Allow setting who is allowed to see the status in the global group person settings Global default group default person Ask for the global default setting the first time a status is set 4 Allow requesting a status from other people on the contact list 5 Optional Allow actively sending status to a group or person Which should behave exactly like a me message e g be shown in the message history too 5 Display any received statuses in the contact list with the icon of the user changing accordingly and the status text appearing below the user name Optional Make it possible to switch off requesting statuses e g for bandwidth reasons Because everything is private and encrypted and user configured nobody risks being stalked unless he actively wants to E g to tell your partner or your parents

column2: Regression persistent blob files not deleted on send
column3: I noticed this weekend while testing another PR that files saved by PersistentBlobProvider are longer being cleaned up when the media message is sent I verified that they were being cleaned up properly around 21 Nov so a regression was likely introduced to master at some point since then Steps to reproduce 1 adb shell ls la data data org thoughtcrime securesms app captures to verify state 2 Select an image in Gallery Photos 3 Share with Signal 4 Tap on a recipient 5 Observe the conversation with a thumbnail of the image 6 adb shell ls la data data org thoughtcrime securesms app captures 7 Observe that the new encrypted image file has been saved 8 Tap the Send button 9 adb shell ls la data data org thoughtcrime securesms app captures 10 Behold the not cleaned up encrypted image file 11 Bonus note the lack of W AttachmentManager cleaning up content in the log After some debugging I found that in AttachmentManager getSlideUri was returning null Although this commit was merged before bumping to 3 5 0 I may not have yet rebased at the time that I had observed proper cleanup Or I'm barking up the wrong tree The recent database version upgrade is making going back to that time not so simple Device info Nexus 5 stock Android 6 0 MRA58K Signal 3 6 0 bde6c90 App state Signal registered SMS enabled default SMS app

column3: I can remove a complete conversation including text messages and entries for accepted missed calls in it I can also remove single text messages from a conversation However I cannot remove just single or all call entries from a conversation which I would have expected to be possible I rarely delete a complete conversation as there usually are some messages in it that I still want to keep This currently implies that I also have to keep all call entries which is slightly annoying as they contain practically no information In my opinion to make removing call entries possible there should be at least one of the following features 1 I should be able to select and remove call entries just like text messages 2 I should be able to lock text messages so they are not removed when I delete the conversation This is currently on Signal 3 6 1 on Android

column2: PNG scaled JPEG attachment saves with png extension
column3: When sending a media message with a PNG attachment Signal converts the PNG to JPEG and scales it before sending Later when choosing to save the image from the conversation this JPEG is saved with a png extension This occurs because Attachment updateAttachmentData replaces the attachment data stream without updating the attachment content type Steps to reproduce 1 Take a completely unamusing screenshot PNG to send to a contact 2 Open Signal 3 Open the conversation with said contact 4 Tap the Attach button 5 Tap the Image button 6 Select the new screenshot from the documents provider 7 Observe the draft media message with thumbnail 8 Tap the Send button 9 Wait for the media message progress to complete converting to JPEG scaling sending 10 Long press the media message 11 Tap the Save button 12 Reluctantly embrace the security warning 13 Observe the new Signal yyyy mm dd hhmmss png in sdcard Pictures 14 adb pull this curious file and check check it 15 Behold a JPEG in disguise Device info Nexus 5 stock Android 6 0 MRA58K Signal 3 5 0 473e470 App state Signal registered SMS enabled default SMS app

column2: Swipe to delete
column3: I took a shot at issue 3354 swipe to delete For now it implements the swiping gestures and events inside ConversationListItem following the same pattern used for click and long press It replaces the old click and long press listeners as swiping has complex interactions with touch events handling and handling all of them in one place make it more consistent and easier Gestures are modelled after the GestureDetector class specific cases like multi finger touches are handled too It also plays well with the parent RecycleView scrolling I tried to make it work nicely and avoid to subclass it and it seems to have worked It reproduces as closely as possible gmail behaviour What is missing and IMO separate broader issues is what to do after swiping delete archive or let the user choose with a do nothiing option too Through preferences maybe right now both swipe to left and swipe to right do a delete Undo right now it is just a delay for delete an item is scheduled for delete in 5 seconds if users press Undo deletion is cancelled An interesting alternative is to do not actually delete the message s alter MessagingDatabase tables to mark an item as deleted add something like a delete time then periodically sweep tables This second option may be the starting point for an archive or recycle bin functionality which I believe would be an entirely new interesting feature issue I tried to stay as close to your coding style as possible Let me know what you think

column2: In thread notification sounds do not respect Android priority mode
column3: With Android sounds set to Priority Mode the incoming message notification sound is still audible when viewing an active conversation I believe that if priority notifications are turned off for Signal then all notifications including in thread notifications should be silenced when Android is in priority only mode So these in thread notifications should be silenced as well in Priority mode since they are not priority notifications To clarify the android priority setting works for the other notifications from the Signal app the issue only affects the in thread notifications I am using Signal 3 6 1 on Android 5 1 1 I have an LG Nexus 4 device with T Mobile USA as the carrier

column2: Wording ambiguity Archived conversation Conversation archived
column3: FREEBIE Issue There are 3 occurrences of 'Archived conversation s ' in Signal with 2 different meanings 'Archived conversations' means 'Conversations have been archived' i e archiving completed 'Archived conversation' means 'Conversation has been archived' i e archiving completed But 'Archived conversations d ' means 'Conversations which have been archived' I have seen incorrect translations at Transifex because of this ambiguity Solution Change the first two strings into 'Conversations archived' and 'Conversation archived' for differentiation I would think this is less ambiguous but I'm not a native speaker At the very least it uses 2 different wordings for the 2 different meanings So it is your judgment if this makes sense

column2: Add delivery date time for outgoing SMS Signal messages info
column3: Feature proposal Add delivery date time for outgoing SMS Signal messages in message details In a similar way that we can see when the incoming message was both sent and delivered in the message details dialog add this functionality to the outgoing messages Right now only sent date time is shown there Regarding privacy implications this will not change anything there no extra info is required from the recipient to provide Just present the already non secret second checkmark is timestamp in a more convenient way to the user via message details dialog Just as the second checkmark itself the usability of this if obvious especially if a contact in a bad reception area and you do not get the second checkmark right away For SMS this functionality is provided by most SMS apps if delivery receipts are enabled So in a way using Signal as SMS client in current form reduces this sms functionality so for SMS case it might as well be considered as a bug

column3: Until now when message delivery fails and the currently visible activity is the MessageDetailsActivity of the failed message you get a notification Tapping on it brings you back to the ConversationActivity in which you tap on the failed message to get back to the MessageDetailsActivity you just came from Instead I propose to treat the notification as an in thread notification only play a sound do nothing depending on the user setting for in thread notifications Does not seem like there is a bug report for this but I think it is more logical this way

column2: RCS e integration

column2: Sending an SMS to short code like 18100 changes it to COUNTRY CODE 18100
column3: I was trying to send an SMS to the number 18100 and it got changed to 35818100 and the SMS did not reach the correct number Some of these SMS short codes and service numbers are national or even per network so adding country code to it changes the number For someone who relies heavily on service numbers this might the biggest reason not to use Signal as main messaging app Here is the only quote I found on the topic declaring them national Short codes only work within one country they are not international Premium rated short messages Short Message Service Wikipedia Premium rated short messages

column2: Can t send SMS to phone numbers with brackets after upgrade to 3 3
column3: Messages SMS not MMS not data appear to be sent successfully in the UI but are never received by the contact after upgrading to any version later than 3 1 1 Messages from other contacts are still received only sending is broken Manually downgrading to 3 1 1 apk restores SMS sending functionality Other SMS apps continue to work Latest 3 6 1 release from Play Store is still broken Disabling Signal messages in Advanced prefs does not fix the problem Uninstalling and reinstalling does not fix the problem Device info Samsung Galaxy S5 Dev Ed stock Android 4 4 4 Signal 3 6 1 App state Push registered SMS Enabled SMS deliver disabled Wi Fi Calling compatibility disabled phone is not Wi Fi Calling enabled MMS Default settings Media auto download disabled Log starting Signal sending SMS This may be related to the shortcode sending problem reported around the same time but I am not sending to shortcode contacts these are full 10 digit US numbers

column2: MessageNotifier never calls MediaPlayer release
column3: MessageNotifier uses MediaPlayer for playing the notification sound for in thread notifications L316 but never calls MediaPlayer release as strongly suggested in the MediaPlayer documentation the code should either be updated to call release in a final block or my preference stop interacting with the MediaPlayer directly and let the Ringtone class handle this like so Ringtone manages a MediaPlayer instance internally and takes care of release and all that stuff

column2: Messages sent to group delivered to private chat after the sender uses a new PreKey
column3: Sender is Device LG G3 running Lolipop TextSecure 2 6 4 2 7 1 not sure Receiver is Device Nexus 5 running Lolipop TextSecure 2 7 1 Issue details 1 An existing TextSecure user switched to a new phone and installed TextSecure on it 2 The user sent a message to an existing group member which accepted his new identity then added him to the group 3 Other group members did not yet approve his new identity 4 Whenever the user with a new identity sends a message to the group users who did not yet accept his new identity receive a private chat notification asking them to confirm his unknown identity or cancel 5 after confirming each confirm identity notification the message which was supposed to be delivered to the group is delivered to the private chat instead of group chat 6 no idea about future messages but i believe they would be delivered normally to the group after confirming the identity

column2: You can still send messages when you are left alone in a group
column3: If you leave a group the thread is not deleted but you lose the ability to type in the input box and send messages 1 I assume this is the expected behavior as you might still want to view past messages after leaving However if everyone else leaves the group you can still do everything type text add attachments and send messages This makes no sense since there are no recipients anymore The thread should be locked as in the case above where you are the one who leaves Adding more people updating group should unlock the conversation again kalevi helvetti optimized There are many issues about groups but could not find anything about this case TS 2 12 0 stock Android 5 1 Edit Here is a debug log after the following steps Open TS first time after boot Go to a group All the other people leave the group in this debug log all the other people one person I send a message to the empty group 1 You can still type using the TS emoji drawer Also you can add attachments But it might be best to add this as a separate issue

column2: TS crashes as soon as I enter my passphrase every single time
column3: I was conversing with a friend who uses Signal We typically use regular SMS as my friend is accustomed to using iMessage by default On occasion we converse via encrypted messaging So on my end my conversation thread is a mix of SMS and encrypted messages This is the case with a few other friends as well Today we were conversing via SMS and my friend sent an MMS which was likely just a picture of what we were talking about I tapped on the MMS to download it and TS immediately crashed I opened TS again and entered my passphrase and it immediately crashed This continued to happen over and over The app has become unusable I still receive SMS and encrypted messages and notifications If I enter my passphrase TS will crash but I can then see message previews in the pull down notification window I can even use the Mark All As Read option Rebooting my phone has not helped I asked a few other friends to message me via TS and to send TS messages and MMS' with picture attachments in hopes that some state of the app would change Nothing has worked I'm on the latest version of Android and TS My debug log Thank you

column2: Prevent auto backup on Marshmallow by targeting an older version
column3: states that only apps targeting API level 23 or higher will participate in the auto backup By targeting level 22 for now we can re enable ADB based backup restore without risking to leak data to the backup cloud For the long run a proper encrypted backup restore remains the better solution Once that is available we can consider disabling backups again Signed off by Jan Kiszka jan kiszka web de

column2: Exclude meaning rich colors for conversation differentiation initially
column3: I installed Signal on Android and very shortly after got messages from two friends who both use Signal congratulating me on installing it The two conversations were colored primary red and primary green green red I assumed that these colors signified some meaning about the conversations like maybe the green one was secure and the red one was insecure I did some Googling and found Issue 945 which seemed to imply that the issue color indicated the transport medium that the message arrived by I asked and he figured out what was going on that these colors were meant to differentiate conversations from each other I would like to recommend feature request excluding meaning rich colors from use as differentiating conversation colors at least initially to avoid confusing the user If for example the first two conversations were in pastels or in pretty much any two colors other than red and green which have a very strong visual meaning of stop go success error good bad I think I would have begun to intuit that the colors were for conversation differentiation I would also say that if it started out with pastels or some other non meaning rich colors and I later encountered red and green conversations I would probably intuit they were just there for differentiation Since it looks like conversation color is driven directly by the contacts name L8 L16 I'm not sure it would make sense to tweak the initial colors as the user begins using the app Since by my read of the list of colors L13 L36 only red and green have a strong meaning All the others seem not meaning rich to me maybe just remove red and green Problem there is that existing users mapping of which conversations have which colors would change possibly confusing people So hopefully someone here has a better idea of a solution here than what I have come up with

column2: Allow the choice of font size for chat screen
column3: Allow the choice of font size for chat screen either exact size in points or simply small medium large will likely be more than enough It is a basic option supported by most messengers even by the stock sms client I have a 6 smartphone and the standard font size is way too large for my screen which could easily and usefully fit much more text Others e g those with poor eyesight or those with small screens might find the standard font size too small to read comfortably I believe this would be a useful feature and one that is probably pretty straightforward to implement

column2: Consider SMS spam blocking features
column3: Signal is my favourite application for both SMS and encrypted messaging However given the fact that SMS spam is on the rise It would be a very useful feature to support some sms spam blocking There are many third party application that do this but they require changing the default SMS application I think any of the following features would be useful Options to only issue a notification for messages from known contacts Word based classification blacklists perhaps with an option to never block messages from known contacts Number blacklists arguably easy for spammers to circumvent Of course there are more sophisticated options as well but these may provide the greatest bang for buck

column2: Strip off blank new lines in a message
column3: Whenever there is a message which contains extra new blank lines at the end they are not stripped off the message is sent along with those newlines at the end Normally if the lines are blank they are removed before the message is sent

column2: Prefill registration form with user is phone number no need for manual input
column3: During registration just after installation the user has to enter its phone number manually The national code e g 49 is prefilled This is not optimal because Users are psychologically relactant to actively enter personal data like phone number that is sent to some server which they have just heard about somewhere So I have really seen friends aborting the registration at this very step This is really a UX issue It is about 9 unnessary keystrokes more At least in Europe people mess up with the leading 0 in phone numbers A lot of people without internatinal relations do not know or at least are puzzled about that the leading 0 is to be ignored after the internal code of 49 Would be good if the users phone number could be automatically retrieved from the phone by Signal and the number prefilled into the input form A user could still change the prefilled number just in case

column2: Support for group nicknames
column3: Caution This PR updates the database This PR adds support for nicknames in groups The user can set a custom nickname in the chat preferences This nickname will be included in all group messages The recipients will show the nickname if they do not have the sender in their contact list Nicknames from other people are stored in the RecipientPreferenceDatabase Example group nickname Needs WhisperSystems libtextsecure java 19 Fixes 4852

column2: Wording Improve some strings in Privacy preferences
column3: FREEBIE Fixes Change 'Enable lock screen for messages' to 'Lock Signal and message notifications with a passphrase' Change 'Forget passphrase from memory after some interval' to 'Auto lock Signal after a specified time interval of inactivity' Change 'Timeout passphrase' to 'Inactivity timeout passphrase' Change 'Timeout interval' to 'Inactivity timeout interval' Remove unused string resource preferences the amount of time to wait before forgetting passphrase Remove unused string resource preferences pref timeout interval dialogtitle Possibly 'Auto lock Signal after a specified time out interval of inactivity' would be better not sure Let me know if this is the case Perhaps more in line with preferences inactivity timeout interval 'Inactivity timeout interval' I have added that 'inactivity' stuff as I have noticed that I had no clue if the timeout interval is calculated from a the moment of entering the passphrase or b the last activity it is the latter I have tested it

column2: setting to disable notifications for new contacts

column2: Improve plaintext export and import
column3: This PR implements the export of MMS messages without attachments only text fixes the import of group messages to the correct group thread instead of the sender is thread and fixes the export of the delivered state of Signal messages Previously messages sent in group threads were not exported because they are always stored in MmsDatabase even if they only contain text I m not sure if this is intended or a bug The assignment to the correct group thread is implemented by adding an additional xml attribute thread address that contains the thread recipient if that differs from the message recipient For groups this is an id like this textsecure group 1b92cba8 The app SMS Backup Restore doesn t know this tag but simply ignores it when opening the Signal backup When importing into a new Signal instance the group thread will be called Unnamed group and you can t send messages to the group until another member sends a group update message Fixes 3024 The last commit removes some attributes from the xml items that are always stored as null or 0 These attributes are marked as optional in the schema file of SMS Backup Restore see I ll have a look at exporting attachments later but that will be for another PR

column3: Other than WhatsApp or Telegram Signal does not distinguish between a received message and a seen message Whatsapp and Telegram indicate that a message has been seen by coloring the double check mark Signal does not color the double check mark When I first started using Signal this really confused me It felt like something did not work like the other person was not reading my messages I think it might help new users if Signal adopted the de facto standard by coloring the double check mark in the primary color of the conversation

column3: Per documentation the user is unable to get a call first registration This alienates users who use calling only cell plans where sending and receiving texts is possible but costs money A simple solution would be to add a call me instead button to the bottom left of the Connect With Signal prompt which immediately calls the user register This would allow those users to use Signal while causing no friction to anyone else Side note Although I do not know for sure I believe the iOS app behaves in the same way Can anyone else confirm

column2: Manual SMS validation
column3: Hi I tried to validate my Google Voice number which I know you have as a known issue as not working But my issue is why you do not allow manual validation I to receive the SMS over Google Voice and it is just not caught by the app The next step is to be called and manually enter what I hear in a text box My question is why do not you allow the validation text box to be used for SMS too It is great that you have the automatic SMS validation it is user friendly but after the timeout you could just leave the option to have the SMS code manually entered It would offer more flexibility and I do not see what would be the downside if I am wrong do tell Thanks

column2: Bad UX with expiring Signal versions
column3: Signal can literally expire any second so that out of a sudden you are not able to send messages anymore well of course only if you do not update it for 90 days Immediately updating the app right then might not be possible if you require a wifi connection I am sure that this is not a problem for any of the people involved here but for other non tech savvy users it can be firsthand experience Reasons for apps not updating automatically new permission required happened before the RedPhone integration not enough free space on the device available for some other reason it is not uncommon for me to see 10 or so pending app updates on other peoples is devices There should be a time triggered warning or some other trigger to inform the user beforehand

column2: RTL support appears to be incomplete

column2: Fix call volume
column3: I am also affected by the low sound volume in calls see 4733 In my case that is because of the setBluetoothScoOn true for all calls It will switch to bluetooth although not connected and thus show the bluetooth icon for the current volume setting The workaround that was mentioned which is enabling and disabling the speaker works because it will call setBluetoothScoOn false in enableDefaultRouting Furthermore stopBluetoothSco was never called I also removed the initializeAudio because the ringers will now request the audio focus themselves And for every audio mode setting I added a focus request and vice versa Also fixes 4188

column2: Direct capture front camera preview different compared to taken picture
column3: When taking a picture with the front camera using direct capture in collapsed state the resulting image is different compared to the preview The preview shows the lower portion from a full screen capture while the resulting image is from the middle portion of a full screen capture I will try to explain the issue with an image series The first one is an image of the phone with the camera preview Note the detail marked with the red circle in the upper right corner tmp 18514 2015 12 26 23 47 43 2040068800 The next one is the preview of the taken picture Note the detail mentioned before is now in the lower left corner tmp 18514 2015 12 26 23 46 481570556342 I wanted to take a screenshot from the camera preview but strangely the screenshot shows the view like for the taken picture This is why the first pictures a not screenshots See the third picture tmp 18514 2015 12 26 23 50 42 109390329 The last image is a full screen capture of the same scene I suppose the region in the camera preview is different to the final region applied tmp 18514 2015 12 26 23 51 42 2006969739 This happens only with the front camera using direct capture in collapsed state The back camera works as expected Device info Samsung Galaxy S5 Mini Stock Android 4 4 2 Signal 3 8 1 Debug log

column2: Signal will not use permissions with Privacy Guard enabled nor prompt for confirmation code
column3: Cyanogenmod is Privacy Guard has three settings for each permission Allow Ask Each Time or Deny When set to Ask Each Time it will ask you every time the app uses the permission whether you want to allow that Signal however will not even try I do not want Signal to read incoming SMS messages so I ask it to Ask If it then wants to read the incoming text message it can ask me and I can either deny or allow it for that one instance like when I'm actually waiting for Signal is registration text I would allow it Instead Signal does not even try to read incoming texts anymore This is the first app I ever encountered whose behavior changes after setting it to Ask instead of Allow so it is probably a bug in Signal or a feature if you wrote code to check for permissions So if it does not even try to use the permission because apparently it assumes it is disallowed or it broke or something then I would expect a box to be there where I can put in the confirmation code In fact I would always expect that box to be there regardless of whether the app thinks it got its shit together but that is a separate discussion Instead what Signal does is let the time expire then you can request a call which works then I reject the call and then finally I can put in the confirmation code And then what It says could not connect to server no right you only requested an SMS and a call and that worked just fine but see my other issue for that

column2: Using android 4 4 4 TaskManager to close Signal does not behave correctly
column3: Hi On my Android 4 4 4 I can open the Task Manager by pressing the Home button for a while Then I can slide applications on the left right to kill close them The default and correct behaviour is that when I kill an App I stay in the TaskManager so that I can kill more apps Unfortunately when I kill Signal the TaskManager itself is closed so that if I want to kill several App I must ensure that Signal is the last one I kill otherwise I have to run again the TaskManager since Signal has killed it This is very inconvienient

column2: Outgoing cyphered message not sent but GUI says so
column3: Hi My phone is rarely connected to the Internet When I send a cyphered message the GUI tells me everything is OK double check mark is shown date of departure is right now l'instant in French etc even if there is no internet connection and the message has not left my device There should be at least a warning that the message has not been sent better that an internet connection is required or even better a proposition to start a connection Wifi 4G or an automatic opening closing of a connection just to send the message

column2: Internet connexion required warning
column3: Hi First of all thanks for acting for our privacy I'm having a phone that is very seldomly connected to internet I installed Signal and started using it before realizing that the cyphered SMS MMS Calls required internet conection Wifi 4G etc to work and that my friends did not receive my messages This is not normal There should be plenty of warnings telling users that the cyphered parts of the software ONLY work when an internet connexion is up running Warning can be placed when installing when sending a message etc

column2: Answer to a non cyphered message is cyphered
column3: Hi As I said in previous bug reports my phone is seldomly connected to the internet and cyphered messages are not sent if no connection is up running As a consequence when I have no internet connection and I want to contact a friend I sent a non cyphered SMS Unfortunately when my friend replies to such a message Signal sends a cyphered response Since I have no connection I cannot receive it I think that using crypto by default is a good idea but warning the user that she is replying in a different mode than the one used by the sender would be welcome

column2: Disconcerting 'X is on Signal say hey ' notifications
column3: I'm submitting this report on behalf of a concerned friend Their phone is setup in such a way that many of the contacts stored in the phone are not to be contacted directly i e via the phone number registered with WhisperSystems These contacts are only to be contacted via some off channel email other phone etc Anyways upon installing or updating I do not recall which it was to the latest version of Signal they received a number of 'X is on Signal say hey ' notifications Obviously this was very disconcerting as the first thought was that people on the other end might be receiving similar notifications Is that the case or are they one way in the sense that you only receive notifications for numbers that you already have in your contacts Surely Signal is not leaking contact details to third party users This seemed to be very un Signal like behavior and the person in question was concerned enough to consider discontinuing use of the app I wanted to find out more regarding this behavior beforehand as this issue is very unclear Perhaps there is some way to opt out of this or preferably make it opt in Some clarification would be much appreciated Thanks for the awesome product by the way

column2: Check if Identical Publickey is send back at keyexchange
column3: Hello there i noticed that in SMSSecure i know where i am there is kind of a glitch that if you send out a key exchange message to a non SMSSecure user and sayed User forwards you that exact Message the communication is afterwards shown to be encrypted which it most likely is but with the own publickey which will result in more gibberish being send to the user I am not sure if this affects Signal too which it probably wo not as the server automatically checks if sayed user has indeed Signal installed but a basic routine that checks if the send back publickey at key exchange is indeed not identical to ones own publickey would be appreciated Truth be told i am by no means a Cryptographer and can not estimate how trivial if at all such a routine would be to be implemented and even if this is something you consider important as it is a probably a rather rare occasion I am just forwarding this to the crypto guys which created the underlying protocol in the first place Greetings Henry Kratom

column2: The landscape compose window seems to have old UI

column2: Signal location messages fail to auto snap to more precise locations
column3: Hi Signal 3 9 0 introduces location messages While generating such a location message the phone starts GPS service of the device Typically position precision increases after several seconds in several steps But Signal stays at the very first inaccurate position Other messengers like Telegram keep track on position updates and always auto snap to the newest typically most accurate position In Signal I have to press the center button several times before sending the location message in order to send an exact position It would be great if Signal supports auto snap like other messengers

column2: Use Signal without needing a phone
column3: Id like to be able to use signal on my wifi tablet without needing a phone Also requiring a user to sign up with a unique identifier like a phone number seems to be like the first obvious identifier we would not want to require a user to submit if we are interesting in anonymity Snowden talks about unique identifier databases Bleep allows account creation with just a key pair My request is not to require the user to submit identification information on a device that tracks their physical location can be pinpointed by a stingray and is most likely directly linked to their billing records It also makes it a pain to keep a signal account portable when a user changes phone numbers If a user wants to submit their phone number so that their contacts can locate them that way fine but as a requirement its a total game killer

column2: Signal cannot connect even though it just did
column3: System info Cyanogenmod based on Android 4 4 Steps to reproduce 1 Install Signal from the Play Store and open it 2 Enter phone number and hit register It now shows a couple of steps connect to server waiting for sms generating keys and something else I annoyingly can not make a screenshot a bug exclusive to this app The connect to server to request an SMS succeeds Then SMS arrives and Signal goes on to generate keys When that finishes which is really quick it complains about not being able to connect to the server Wait what It can contact the servers to send an SMS but is then unable to contact the server I guess it must be a bug

column2: Use OpenStreetMap as location provider

column2: Group messages are imported incorrectly from backup
column3: I just did a factory reset and imported a plaintext backup Then I noticed that a group I belong to shows only my own messages All messages from other members are displayed in their individual conversations not in the group they were originally sent to Before the reset I made a plaintext backup and left the group After the reset I imported the backup and had another member add me to the group again New messages are displayed correctly it is just the history from the backup that is slightly messed up After noticing the problem I tried deleting all conversations and importing the backup again but the group history is still spread out across the conversations of the group members Here is the link to the debug log submitted after the second import I am also using the Signal Desktop beta The registered devices seem to keep their own version of the history even if you re register so obviously I did not have to import a backup there All messages in the group and the conversations with individual contacts are displayed properly on my desktop machines

column2: Group messages partially delivered on poor network conditions
column3: Hi on poor network conditions I often see that Signal indicates a failed delivery while some group members have received the message Signal does not indicate which group member have received the message and which not Re sending leads to some group members receiving the message with multiple copies In order to avoid such issues it should be possible to implement a solution based on the following principle Indicate the server that a message to x group members is prepared to be sent Transfer all encrypted messages for each participant to the server The server waits until messages for each participant have been received The server delivers the messages Found with Signal 3 9 1

column2: Unregistered contacts do not disappear in groups
column3: If a user unregisteres from Signal but did not leave a group the user will stay in this group forever and you will get an error for every message you send to that group I suggest that the all groups of a user should be automatically updated when he unregisters There are many similar issues but not the same I think 4550 2408 I fear that this might be an issue for the server because the clients should not do this

column2: Moved Help section to the top of the README
column3: Lots of 'average users' probably wo not scroll past all the 'technical' information bug reports beta translations bitcoin etc and are therefor likely to miss the Help section and direct their isimple' requests questions to the wrong place like issues Technical users are far more likely to read the whole thing and should therefor not be negatively impacted by this change This PR tries to address that issue It may be useful to add another level 1 type header below it named Contributing for example to make the distinction more clear I have not done it yet as it is easier to add a commit then to aremove' it Cherry picking would be another option This PR is of course a FREEBIE wink If this is the wrong way to indicate this please point me on how to do it properly

column2: Signal does not resync known contacts
column3: This is a duplicate of 4338 as this issue was already closed See also maybe related issues I pointed out there In short If Signal already knows phone numbers of contacts it does not resync with the phone contacts in case they are deleted or changed I had for some reason multiple local phone contacts To get rid of them I deleted all my contacts from my phone and resynced them with DavDroid from my server Since then Signal has not changed any of my contacts to add them as a Signal user I'm running Signal 3 9 1 on Android 5 1 1 CM 12 1 on a rooted device It seems that Signal does not check the contacts anymore for already known numbers Things I tried Sync Signal via Settings Accounts refresh contacts in Signal itself When I display only Signal contacts none of the former Signal contacts are shown In fact only my own contact shows up I can also confirm that this happened on a non rooted Samsung Galaxy S4 mini running Android 4 4 and Signal 3 9 1 There the contacts had been deleted and resynced with Google The only solution which helped to add Signal users in contacts again was to reinstall the app

column2: Upgrade Gradle to 2 10 and Android plugin to 1 5 0
column3: The main reason behind this change was to enable Gradle tarball checksum verification introduced in Gradle recently It is a great companion to already used gradle witness plugin Due to a bug in Android Plugin for Gradle 2 10 was considered less than 2 2 It was fixed in recently released 1 5 0 Unfortunately the checksums are not even published by Gradle team not to mention digital signing FREEBIE

column3: Hi I factory reset my phone and installed Signal and I reinstalled Signal multiple times now The registration process is without problem If I do not set Signal as the default SMS app it shows no contacts whatsoever allthough I resynced every possible account on the phone multiple times If I set Signal as the default SMS app it shows every contact twice once from the google account and once from the whatsapp account I think allthough the rest of the phone handles identical entries without a problem Also Contacts who write me still appear as phone numbers only and not in any way with a name neither in groups nor in the chat overview nor in single chats In either case Groups where I am part of pop up when someone writes something in them but they have cryptic names in popups textsecure group 1c20d and are named Unnamed Group inside the App I can not reply in these groups the keyboard dos not even open Also showing Group Members gives an empty Popup This is by far not the first time I have Killer Issues with Textsecure Signal broken chats that can not be resolved Contacts Syncing allways broken Groups after reinstall yes this is by far not the first time I'm having that issue just the completely broken contacts are my main Issue right now Which saddens me because this is otherwise just an awesome Product and with Desktop support would replace 2 other messaging apps at once for me of which I have about 5 at the moment I seriously believe there are enough people that sent you debug logs and everything on similiar or the same issues but if you need some I can provide them with or without SMS enabled Debug Log

column2: Signal crashes when notification sound is set to none and in conversation notifications are enabled
column3: Android 5 1 Signal 3 9 1 also observed on previous versions can not be more specific If notification sound is set to None and In conversation notifications are turned on Signal will crash whenever you receive a message while having the conversation open This only occurs when the conversation the message is a part of is currently open It does not occur if a different conversation is open or if Signal is in the background When you re open the app the message that caused the crash will display properly This affects both Signal conversations and regular SMS conversations with Signal as the SMS client

column2: Fix silent in thread notification
column3: Fixes 5090 Explicitly handle silent empty uri to avoid fallback ringtone being played FREEBIE

column2: Fix five strings in strings xml
column3: Fixed one ambiguous pronoun one remaining reference of ambiguous 'lock screen' See issuecomment 167146108 three cases of 'click' 'tap' And gets rid of unnecessary line breaks in two strings As a side note There are still some strings which have 'click' in their name but all the values use 'tap' so users would not benefit from changing them and thus I ignored them

column2: Add support for any filetype
column3: Why does signal place arbitrary limitations on what filetypes can be sent It is ridiculous A file is a file Signal should not be interested in what files I'm sending it is supposed to be private For example it refused to send a PDF zip 7z and so on

column2: Signal does not show which SIM received message when on dual SIM devices
column3: I have a dual SIM phone and use Signal instead of the preinstalled SMS app When I receive new messages I have no possiblity to find out to which SIM card the message was send to Since this information is definetly available to the system it would be nice to have an option in settings to show for new messages which SIM card received it

column2: Delivery of push messages to some contacts fails works only if Signal is opened
column3: I have a contact which only sees my push messages when she opens Signal On my end they are marked as sent but not delivered The notification about new messages is also missing Sending and SMS to the same contact works all the time My contact has one other messenger app WhatsApp Can this cause conflicts I only have Signal and I'm also not seeing this issue with other contacts that only have Signal I was told that WhatsApp works at the same time as expected

column2: Audio attachment button should always offer selection between file from disk and new recording
column3: If you press the audio button in the attachment screen you get asked if you want to add a file from storage or record something In this window you can select an option to always use the selected app I know that this is a system dialog This leads to the point where some contacts can not send me audio recordings because they made that choice a long time ago Signal should offer a button to always record a new message like you can always make a new photo with the camera

column2: Bad encrypted message if ending a session arrives too late
column3: Android seems to get confused if it receives end secure session message later than the messages sent after it Steps 1 In a conversation with an Android 2 Android turns on airplaine mode 3 I end the session 4 I send three messages 5 Android turns off airplaine mode 6 Android receives two of my messages 7 Android receives my end session message 8 Android receives my third message and it is a Bad encrypted message 9 Android sees all subsequent messages from me as Bad encrypted message 10 If Android sends me a message everything works again end session bad encrypted message The screen shots and logs are from Desktop 0 1 9 and Android 3 9 1 But I'm able to reproduce this just between two Androids as well Desktop log Android spammy log

column2: Message Length Limits Are Not Enforced
column3: On Android 4 4 4 TextSecure version 2 21 0 Sony Xperia Tablet Compact Z3 I found that pasting an extremely long draft message I was inspired by 3388 into the new message box will bring up the max message length indicator without actually enforcing it Hence we can get negative characters remaining as shown below I was still able to send this message without issue to a Signal app interestingly it causes Signal to crash while trying to load the message I'm assuming that the desired behavior is to actually enforce message length restrictions so I will look into this Steps to Reproduce 1 Write a really long draft message until you get past 2000 characters 2 Profit device 2015 07 13 220630

column2: block typing if max length exceeded
column3: When typing a really long message textsecure used to block the typing when I reached the max length limit It just happened to me that I exceeded that limit without noticing and sent a message that was automatically trimmed while being sent Please notify the user that the message will be trimmed or prevent the typing in the first place Do not know in which version this problem arose

column2: No notification if a message was not received
column3: Dear Madam or Sir Unfortunately Signal contains a bug that makes it unusable for me For me there are many situations in which a message is not received Not send due to missing online connection by myself Not received due to missing online connection by receiver Not received due to uninstalled Signal without un registering the device of the receiver It would be more than helpful if Signal would notify me in these situations e g after 30 seconds so that I can decide to wait or to call SMS the receiver I m aware that the one or two check marks show this information but in practice people don t pay attention to this detail and assume that the message was send Best regards MH2016s

column2: Unable to register when using SIM with transfered number
column3: Classic case of operator switch with mobile number transfer When I'm trying to register it shows the number which was assigned to the sim card before my number was transferred When I change it to the correct one I'm getting the verification SMS but the app shows Connectivity error Signal was unable to connect to the server Some possible problems include No network connectivity Restrictive firewall Obviously I'm connected with both WiFi and 3G Same happens when I'm only on WiFi and 3G

column2: SMS sending receiving not working for secondary users
column3: I have installed signal in a secondary user profile Android 5 1 1 Signal 3 9 1 and enabled signal as default SMS app as well as enabled that profile to make calls and send sms Signal is not installed for the primary user phone owner I verified that the system SMS app is receiving SMS fine however as soon as I switch to signal as the default SMS app I no longer receive SMS on that profile If I switch back to the primary user the SMS is there Unless I am missing something important I do not see why signal should not be able to handle this case e g if a user wants to use signal with a different Google account and or sync contacts from a different source than the main account my case This is the log I get this I assume that indicates an incoming SMS I have the feeling I saw the second message quite often in correlation with this when I tested it

column2: Extremely Slow MMS on AT T
column3: Sending and receiving MMS on AT T takes 20 30 seconds while Google Messenger is nearly instantaneous on a Nexus 6P running Android 6 0 I noticed in the logs that the system was defaulting to the legacy MMS transport rather than Lollipop transport

column2: Verizon MMS Retrieval Extremely Slow
column3: I could not find an open issue that actually describes this other than 4474 which is about AT T Same thing happens here When I receive an MMS message eg in a group thread it takes upwards of one to two minutes to retrieve I get a message bubble in the individual thread of the group member that I have an MMS message that is being downloaded and it just takes forever Especially since it will only download one at a time something that does not work well in a group thread of six people To quote from the AT T issue thread When I comment out the following code below in the IncomingLegacyMmsConnection class MMS messages are delivered immediately on Wifi or LTE on Verizon Commenting this code appears to force the phone to connect over the MmsRadio connection and solves the problem for Verizon devices I do not have my AT T phone at the moment but I would suspect the AT T phone wo not follow this same code path since it is not a CDMA device Do you know why the code below exists for CDMA devices or Verizon in particular since Verizon does not allow MMS connections over Wifi I feel like I might be hijacking this bug since it was originally AT T specific Let me know if I should create a new bug specifically for Verizon Thanks if isCdmaDevice Log w TAG Connecting directly try return retrieve contentApn transactionId false false catch IOException ApnUnavailableException e Log w TAG e I do not know if this is the actual cause of the issue or not but I though it would be relevant to include and to ping the other person having this problem richteer too I assume from 6af1cea I have switched back to Hangouts to handle SMS for the time being but I can switch back to test and get debug logs if those would be helpful Nexus 5X Verizon Android 6 0 1 January Security Patch Signal 3 9 1

column2: Names with accents diacritics wrong sorted in contact list
column3: Contact list displays names with accents in the wrong order resulting in people named lvaro being sorted after Zacar as not able to attach image at the moment I think COLLATE LOCALIZED in line 150 will do the trick but i'm not a programmer According to what I have found LOCALIZED It instructs SQLite to sort non ASCII characters appropriately Chars with diacritics some call them accents have higher byte codes than the character Z so a plain ASCII sort would not fit to many foreign languages For example the capital A char is byte code is 0x41 and the capital Z char is is 0x5A Then we have the capital A accute which code in Unicode is 0x00C1 So a plain byte code sort would result the to be after the Z But in languages that have this kind of characters the convention is to put those with diacritics as if they did not have the diacritic So the should be together with the plain A at least before B And to illustrate we have below a list of names sorted using their bytecode Thank you very much for your great work

column2: Crash on start when sender name has special chars
column3: Hi While I was testing sending SMS messages I sent few messages to my personal Android phone with Signal set as default SMS application I was sending SMS messages with alphanumeric sender not a number with characters from GSM 7 bit default alphabet GSM 7 bit default alphabet and extension table of 3GPP TS 23 038 2F GSM 03 38 I was testing all special characters so not numbers and not letters but characters from the standard computer keyboard mostly these ones ' After one of the SMS messages received by Signal application crashed when I clicked notification Now it crashes every time I try to run it so I cannot use it I needed to switch back to Hangouts as my SMS application PS I used latest version of Signal from Play Store on Nexus 5 Android 6 0 1 I also sent crash report when system ask to do that Regards

column2: Lock Signal with passphrase and fingerprint
column3: I have been using TextSecure Signal for a while now and want to get more involved with the project I figured adding fingerprint sensor app unlock support for the Android app would be a good first project Before jumping into implementation I found Issue 4439 where someone requested fingerprint app unlock as an alternative to passphrase which was closed as wontfix Was the reasoning for rejecting this feature request due to feature parity with iOS placing trust in the OS is fingerprint store and authentication privacy or security concerns or software testing concerns I'm not sure if the reasoning from Issue 420 significantly intrudes on the security levels I suggest below especially when combined with exponential delays on failed attempts and database wipe after too many failed attempts within a period of time This comes down to giving the user a choice of convenience and security which I assume is why the no passphrase option has not been removed yet I was wondering if I implemented fingerprint app unlock if the Open Whisper team would be interested Requiring both a passphrase and fingerprint is more secure than either one In a public setting with wandering eyes a fingerprint is more secure than a passphrase Fingerprint sensor support would also allow quicker message checking while keeping Signal in a lock after 5 minutes state Here is what I was thinking of adding to the Settings menu always unlocked unlock with passphrase unlock with fingerprint or passphrase require passphrase every X hours passphrase would be required after 3 fingerprint unlock attempts and after any device reboot unlock with passphrase and fingerprint requires both to unlock the phone every time it is locked erase all conversation history after Y failed unlock attempts any combination of fingerprint and passphrase Signal would use the Android Fingerprint API using whatever fingers are registered with the OS

column2: Attack vector added alternative to failed bitmap otherwise app becomes unusable
column3: This could be used by attacker to force use of less secure methods and possibly other damage to device simply by renaming a file to an incorrect mime type A bug report was filed 4228 so more elegant solutions are welcome This patch adds a Util isValidDimensions call from Glide to anticipate failure and prepare a default Bitmap instead of crashing The default error is left in case the default BitMap cannot be used

column2: Different notifications on incoming text messages confusing
column3: Signal 3 9 1 When I have no unread signal messages and I receive a message I will get a notification which contains the sender is name and the message When I have unread signal messages and I receive a message from a different contact I will get a notification which shows Most recent from Contact name and does not contain the text of the most recent message Maybe this bothers me more than others due to my use case but as I use a pebble which receives the text of notifications this means that whenever I receive a message and I have another unread message I will not be able to see the text of the newest message on my pebble It will only receive the text of the new Most recent from Contact message I would like for there to be a notification setting to turn off this summary notification

column2: Android Wear notifications
column3: Successor of One stack group element per contact is displayed Messages appear in the order they were received latest message bottom Notifications are ordered by the time of latest message arrival Contacts with the newest message appear on top Bug on Android 5 0 and 5 1 If an alarm ringtone vibration is set on the summary notification every single thread message appears on the handheld If an alarm is set on the single thread notifications the more notifications arrive the more alarms are kicked off To work around the issue the summary notification is priority is set to wouldefault' instead of 'high' which suppresses the heads up notification This notification is shown in the Android notification bar nevertheless Users enabling this workaround will often read notifications on the wearable and therefore not miss the heads up notification On older newer devices this setting has no effect the summary notification is displayed as usual See Developed with Sebastian Chlan sebastian chlan gmail com FREEBIE

column2: Unable to take normal calls while speaking on Signal
column3: Dear Whispter Systems first of all I would like to express my HUGE appreciation for your product I have been testing a LOT of apps and your is by FAR the best out there I absolutely admire the CRYSTAL CLEAR call quality it is really outstanding Although your app is almost perfect I would kindly like to ask you to take a look at one issue which troubles me and if this gets fixed I would pronounce your product as PERFECT When speaking on Signal if somebody tries to call me by phone he simply gets a voice message that I am unable to take his call and I just get an entry in the missed calls list This is not OK as I need to call back that person I would like to be informed about incoming calls and have the possibility to pause or drop the Signal call and to take the normal phone call Please kindly make it the default behaviour or provide an option that would enable this behaviour Many thanks

column2: Conversation list floating action button is symbol is ambiguous
column3: The graphical symbol pencil of the floating action button in the conversation list does not make much sense A pencil usually represents writing But tapping that floating action button opens Signal is contact list and is btw currently the only way to achieve that which is not very intuitive Writing in that context could be interpreted as e g a writing a new message within an existing conversation i e in the conversation list or b starting a new conversation i e in the contact list One the other hand a plus sign represents adding like in adding a new conversation Within the context of the conversation list I'm not aware of any other imaginable interpretations so a plus sign is not ambiguous regarding its purpose So in conclusion I suggest that the pencil symbol is replaced by a plus sign An alternative possibility would be using that contacts symbol pictured below after all tapping the button opens Signal is contact list CC patterns actions fab qualities1

column2: What happened to encrypted SMS fallback
column3: I just installed the latest Signal 3 9 1 and installed it on GFs phone as well Then I text her and she did not get my text until she turned her data on the next day This used to work so well especially in our country where mobile data is finite and very expensive and where we may not want to have our data enabled for fear of further tracking random apps eating your cap Sending messages over data is great and all I understand the metadata security implications of SMS but surely it is better to send metadata in the clear and the message encrypted than sending both in the clear Seemed like a great way to backport encryption to older technologies The other great thing about the app was that you could replace the shitty stock SMS apps that come with smartphones with this beautiful application and get encryption to people who have the same app over data or SMS I read over issue 2847 and they seemed to completely discount this whole user base and the above use cases pretty sad I do not want to have to go back to the shitty stock SMS app

column2: Check if bitmap is not null in createScaledBitmapInto
column3: Once I have tried to share an image from the gallery application on my phone to Signal and it failed resulting in a state such that Signal would not be able to start any more and would directly crash with a NullPointerException I have fixed the reason for this with the following This patch adds an additional check in createScaledBitmapInto that checks if the bitmap resource could be obtained before trying to apply a transformation on it to prevent a NullPointerException

column2: Argentina phone number schemes
column3: Non international phone number are not supported contact does not appears during a search A mobile phone number Mobile phone numbers can appear in multiple way here 54 9 area number 0054 9 area number area 15 number if inside Argentina whatever the caller area code is 15 number if both numbers share the same area Where 9 is the magic number for mobile equivalent to the local 15 and 1 for land lines 15 is the magic number for mobile number contains 6 to 8 digits area can optionally be prefixed by a trunk code of value 0 eg 223 0223 or 11 011 do not know about the cases of the trunk code being mandatory The area is somehow part of the number since the number is registered for a unique and given area But it can be omitted if calling from a device from the same area similarly to the country code 54 which can be omitted if we call from a national device Most contact is phone numbers are registered using the 4th scheme excepting contacts from other regions The Android API already provides the country code From this it may be possible to know the area code depending on the Android API From the above two it should be fairly easy to map phones number from one scheme to another I do not know if heavy modifications are needed but I could at least provide a PR to add test case edit It seems that most of the country specific logic should be handled by the libphonenumber and more specifically If it turns to be true then what keeps the different notation to be understand as a unique contact

Feature request A way to store incoming pictures in bulk
column3: Some of my contacts use Signal to send me pictures of their lives i want to store them permanently rather than in Signal Currently I have to tap each picture individually then the save button then answer a question the tap back rinse and repeat I would like to propose a more efficient way for this scenario Different options could be considered a extend the all images view to allow selecting and storing all pictures at once b an option to automatically store all incoming pictures in a folder on the sd card I'm sure other options might be perceivable Thanks for your consideration

column2: add notification stacking to display message text properly on wearables
column3: You can remove this section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist mark with x between the brackets x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist mark with x between the brackets x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 6P Android 6 0 1 Pebble Time v3 9 2 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the Bithub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Just switched from Telegram and love Signal but hated that notifications did not work properly on my wearable so I decided to take a stab at it I implemented my fix based on Stacking Notifications Single Message image Subsequent Messages stacked so only shows summary whether 1 or multiple threads image image Summary notification always uses the same id the individual stacked notifications use an AtomicInteger to generate unique notification IDs since the multiple messages mean the device gets only summary notifications after there is at least one unread message I modified the MultipleRecipientMessage to show the last name and message in the small version or 'Last message from CONTACTNAME' depending on privacy settings to still always show the latest message in the notification I also reversed the display order of the messages so most recent was at the top to be more in line with how other apps work Gmail and Telegram for instance as well as Google is on examples all intents had to be changed to so that they are distinct see here getActivity 28android content Context int android content Intent int 29 so that a reply sent from a wearable will go to the right person the markAsRead intent had to be modified so that it could mark individual messages as read from a wearable notification as well as marking all as read with the already existing behavior tested with a Pebble but it uses Android Wear so it effectively works the same way interacting with notifications fix for 2525

column2: add notification stacking to display message text properly on wearables
column3: You can remove this section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist mark with x between the brackets x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist mark with x between the brackets x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 6P Android 6 0 1 Pebble Time v3 9 2 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the Bithub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Just switched from Telegram and love Signal but hated that notifications did not work properly on my wearable so I decided to take a stab at it I implemented my fix based on Stacking Notifications Summary notification always uses the same id the individual stacked notifications use a static variable to generate unique notification IDs all intents had to be changed to so that they are distinct see here getActivity 28android content Context int android content Intent int 29 so that a reply sent from a wearable will go to the right person the markAsRead intent had to be modified so that it could mark individual messages as read from a wearable notification as well as marking all as read with the already existing behavior tested with a Pebble but it uses Android Wear so it effectively works the same way interacting with notifications revised 5286 Guess it maybe was not the greatest idea to submit a pull request hours after I should be in bed All is well now fix for 2525 FREEBIE

column2: Question on iOS vs Android
column3: Hello please apologize if my post is not appropriate here I like Signal very much I have installed it on both of my Phones a Samsung phone on Android and on my iPhone And I am really puzzled by the big differences in the app on both OS I could even say that it almost looks like a different app Here I would like to accent on 2 things 1 Some time ago I had raised a question that while speaking on Signal on my Android phone it is not possible to put the Signal call on hold in order to take the phone call I have got an answer that it is not possible On my iPhone though I was surprised that this works I was speaking on Signal I received a phone call and I was able to take the phone call 2 Security settings I was pleased with the many security features offered on Android it is possible to set a PIN code in order to access the app I was also delighted about the option to set a number of messages to be kept which I have set very low so all the old messages simply go to dev zero Both these options are not available on iOS Even when I enter the settings they look almost empty compared to the numerous settings and options on Android Can you please shortly comment on why it is like that Just asking out of curiosity I hope that the app will further evolve on both platforms and will provide even more features Thank you for providing this magnificent software for free I wish you all the best for the future
