column2: Possible bug in send in RtpAudioSender cpp
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description I tried to get Signal working on BlackBerry is Runtime for Android Sadly voice calls only partially working I can call other Signal users but they can not hear my voice I'm getting a lot of sendto failed errors in dev log main After some further debugging I found that sendto L36 always fails with error 22 EINVAL invalid argument As far as I understand the code the socket is already connected in RtpSocket java L50 so a send should be enough in RtpAudioSender cpp L36 I changed sendto to send and got voice calls working I'm not sure if this is a BlackBerry specific issue cause it works with sendto on pretty any Android device Steps to reproduce Install Signal on a BlackBerry Install Cobalt is Google Apps follow the instructions on Cobalt is official Google Apps landing page You need to install Google Account Manager Blackberry Google ID and Google Play services the Google Play store itself is not needed Patch and install Signal follow the instructions on How to patch Android Apps depending on Google Maps and Google Play Services Call a another Signal user Device info Model BlackBerry Passport OS v10 3 2 2836 Android version 4 3 0 Signal version 3 13 0

column2: Does the string Signal system database import make any sense
column3: The recent commit uses the string Signal system database import is complete I am aware that just made the already existing string translatable and replaced TextSecure with Signal so not pointing fingers Signal system database does not make any sense to me i e having Signal and system in the same expression imho contradicts itself There are a Signal is encrypted database and b Android is central database for SMS MMS which is used by other messaging apps What this string means to describe is the process of importing from b to a i e from the system database to Signal is database So this really should read System database import is complete correct While I'm at it I would rather suggest Import of the system is SMS MMS database has been completed this assumes that this string is the text body of a dialog more space for more detailed info available while Import complete is the dialog is title or Import of system database completed if something shorter is needed

column2: Improve error handling if a member of a signal group unregisters
column3: When creating a group with one or more contacts which are not registered with Signal there is a very clear notification that an MMS group will be created which could lead to additional costs Current experience When someone unregisteres from Signal while s he is part of a group the other group members receive error messages saying the message could not be sent even tough it is in fact sent to the remaining members of the group The error message is even more confusing because the message has the same click for more details notification next to it like messages that failed to send because the server could not be reached In the latter case you can see to which members the message failed to send and just click resend to resolve the issue In the a member of a signal group unregistered case there are no more details and nothing to do for the user Proposed experience When Signal notices that a group member is no longer registered there should be a notification that this member was removed from the group and has to be readded manually if they register again A fallback to MMS would probably be the worst option because it could create huge intransparent costs e g for European users leading to the immeadiate removal of the app I'm looking forward to your thoughts and improvement ideas Edit The messages are usually delivered even if the error message is shown But the constant error messages confuse users and make them loose faith in the app

column2: Request for enhancement Autoclose Signal after set inactivity
column3: I would like to present one of our use cases for Signal on Android We use the app for sensitive information exchange but would not only like the communication safe on the communication channel side but also protected from people having access to our phones Therefore we have set a password and set the inactivity time out to a low value Often in a rush you might not be able to lock and close Signal and thus this is done automatically within a minute in our case There are situations in reality where other people temporarily have access to your phone and therefore locking the app is very important Now we would find it very useful additional to the automatic lock after inactivity we could also set an option to automatically close Signal In theory Signal offers everything to achieve what we need to be sufficiently secure if there was not bug 3172 which leaves a screenshot in the recent app overview of your communication in some cases on Android 5 which happens regularly to us An autoclose feature would also work around that problem as the app is automatically closed after a set time out if we forget to close it Automatically closing is very sensible from our point of view as it exactly does what automatically locking does Making sure as much information as possible stays private an open signal windows in the recent apps overview is some tiny bit of information we would like to avoid automatically by setting a timeout Of course if sensitive information exchange happens the user should be sensible enough to make sure he locks and closes the app but in reality all of us are human and there are situations where auto locking and auto closing saves you a lot of trouble I think this also fits well with idea of signal being as simple as possible to use I agree technology can not compensate stupidity of people but that is not what I am requesting Furthermore it would compensate bug 3172 really well as this would not have to rely on the ROM following the rules

column2: Feature Request Internal secure popup keyboard
column3: Hi All I was thinking that it would be cool to have a popup keyboard that opens in the app only This would not be a keyboard app for android really just a series of buttons that are displayed in the app that would allow the user to type seriously secure content without being tracked I know that we could find a keyboard that does not track anything but it seems much more secure to have a internal keyboard that is not a keyboard at all Even if they say they do not track you can not really be sure plus for most of my other activities I enjoy the auto correct and predictiveness of Google Even most of my messages I do not really have an issue with Google storing the data they store But if I did want to send something I was worried about Google seeing having a quick button I could click to open up a keyboard to enter a quick message would be amazing Websites have done this for years typically older government sites They would have a little popup keyboard that you would use your mouse to select they keys to ensure a keylogger was not recording your social security number Seems like a good idea to me what do you think mark with x between the I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read

column2: Update lock notification icons take II
column3: This re opens 5284 Contributor checklist mark with x between the brackets x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 5 Android 6 0 1 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the Bithub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message The lock icons displays in the cached passphrase notification currently have two issues They lack high res versions and look rather blurry on high DPI phones They have a very different shape even though they are part of the same notification For example one of them contains a keyhole the other one does not Here is a proposal for unifying the look somewhat and upgrading the resolution at the same time table tr td img width 300 src td td img width 300 src td tr tr td b Old Look b td td b New Look b td tr table The icons I have added are the official Material Icons which are available under a CC BY 4 0 license The new ic menu lock dark icon is 24dp in the real icon size including a padding which makes it 32dp in total The notification balloon icon icon cached is available in a v11 and a pre v11 version as generated by the Asset Studio The v11 version is white 24dp full icon size with 1dp padding so 22dp in real icon size I have removed the explicit v9 versions as we now have full fallbacks available Apologies again for the mess that the previous attempt for this was It will be a lesson to me to not open PRs while germs are taking over my brain Reviewable start img src height 40 alt Review on Reviewable Reviewable end

column2: Optional periodic check for new messages when push is not working reliably
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description Signal should fall back to periodic update checks when GCM Push does not work Steps to reproduce Tried installing Signal on a Motorola RAZR M with Android 4 4 2 I have a friend with the same model who also has the same issue with Signal I have followed all the steps here The RAZR M does not have any options for Phone specific optimisation When the screen is off push notifications do not work for Signal messages but do work for SMS Only when the screen is unlocked and the Signal app is opened new message notifications arrive Expected behaviour There should be a manual option to perform the same routine as opening the app to check for new messages at a defined interval say every 10 minutes Messages do arrive but only when the app is opened To stop impact to other users for whom GCM Push works properly this setting should be off by default This would mean that Signal messages are at least delivered eventually rather than only when opening the app and manually refreshing Device info Model Motorola RAZR M Android version 4 4 2 Signal version 3 13 1

column2: Add visual indicator when a contact is key is veryfied
column3: Since the verification of other peoples keys is very important I propose adding a visual indicator to the contact display Something like a badge or a star or lock symbol This indicator will be displayed after the user explicitely stated that he had verified the contacts key This is helpful in keeping track of the contact verification status and also would encourage new users to understand that verifiyng keys is important Beste regards Henning

column2: App reading SMS when Signal is locked
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description I am not sure if this is a vulnerability if it is a bug or a feature When using Signal as a default SMS app and enable the locked option as far as I know no one should be able to access any received message However if you have any two factor authentication enable on Google using Google as an example and try to login to your Google account you will receive an SMS and Google will automatically read the SMS and authenticate you without any need of manually having to unlock Signal copy the authentication code and paste it to Google is prompt This should probably work with any app that will automatically read any SMS received to authenticate any 2 second authentication code This concerns me because if I have any type of malware listening to my SMS app it will be able to read any message I receive without worrying if Signal is locked or not Steps to reproduce Remove your Google account from your Android settings Make sure Signal is locked and is your default SMS app Login to your Google Account Wait for the SMS Google will automatically authenticate you Device info Samsung Galaxy S5 running Cyanogen lastest nightly build of KLTE Signal Version 3 13 1

column2: allow panic button apps to lock
column3: First time contributor checklist x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Samsung Galaxy Note 2 Android 4 4 4 Asus ZenFone2 Android 4 4 2 x86 its included in SMSSecure is 3Aclosed author 3Aeighthave official releases so its been tested on a bunch of devices there x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the Bithub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description As discussed back in October face to face with and here is the panic button support We have been developing panic button features in our apps for years and now we are working to make a more flexible and open ecosystem of apps that can both trigger other apps or respond to triggers This has now become a partnership effort called Panic Initiative that has been spun out of Amnesty International is work in conjunction with iilab Guardian Project and Security First Since Signal already includes a lock feature it is a natural panic responder app This setup allows for easy configuration of a single trigger action e g button press which can then trigger multiple apps The first commit adds support for receiving the panic trigger The second commit wipes Signal from the Recent Apps after responding to the panic trigger You can see an example of this user experience in this video The first panic button app that sends this kind of trigger is called Ripple and it is available here Amnesty Panic Button supports this in the beta version v1 4 1 right now More info on the panic kit work here The source repo for the included TrustedIntents library is here

column2: Cryptic failure toast when USERTRUST cert disabled
column3: If the USERTRUST RSA ssl cert Signal uses is disabled in Settings Security Trusted Certificated Signal correctly fails to register However the message is a generic server connection failure Technically correct practically not very helpful To be honest I recently disabled all the certs on my phone and started running apps one by one and approving only what needs approving So far not a single app did too well in these regards A few even failed silently Regardless even if it is not worth improving on I figured I should at least put it out there just in case someone runs into some obscure but related issues I also saw the last few commits touched some elliptic curve cipher related stuff so this might actually be useful one day

column2: Delete and renegotiate identity error in verify identity

column2: Repeatable builds
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates Description My goal is to verify that the APK distributed on Google Play is executing the code at the commit of the release tag on GitHub Even though I trust OWS to publish the untampered code they could be compelled to alter it without revealing it and it is better to know than to assume To do the verification I'm looking at the hash of each file in the APK I get from Google Play and comparing it with the hash of the APK I built myself In build gradle a timestamp is populated as a BuildConfig field at build time This field has millisecond accuracy and is used to expire the binary after 90 days Due to it changing during every build classes dex in the APK has a different hash so it is impossible to verify the integrity of the code Proposal I would like to submit a PR to 1 change the timestamp to be granular only to the day 1458190800000ms 2 be replaceable by an environment or system variable This would allow for easy APK verification The signing date of the Play APK can be used to determine the build date which can then be replaced during a verification build The timestamp can still be used to determine when 90 days have gone by and a build has expired Risks 1 The risk of this feature regressing in the future is fairly high due to the external nature of the verification This could be mitigated by a build step that performs the verification or reduced through good commenting The code I'm using for verification is available here Signal version 3 14 1 and master at time of filing

column2: Signal should open a new tab for each clicked link
column3: Please note this is a bug tracker not a support forum If you need support please use or email support whispersystems org Delete any sections that are not relevant mark with x between the I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Android apps can choose whether their links open a new tab or overwrite any previous tab the app had opened Signal should so the former but does the latter For example if a friend sends a link to a newspaper article about how awesome end to end encryption is and then while I'm reading it I get a message from a restaurant asking me to click a link to confirm my reservation doing so will overwrite the tab where I was reading the article requiring me to go back to that conversation click it again and then find my place again This is annoying and sometimes hard to anticipate who remembers how they opened a tab four hours ago Steps to reproduce click a link in a message you received use the app switcher button to switch back to signal click a different link in a message you received Device info Replace examples with your info Model Google LG Nexus 5X Android version 6 0 1 Signal version 3 14 2 Solution You need to set EXTRA CREATE NEW TAB see EXTRA CREATE NEW TAB for details I guess if some people find the current behavior preferable this could be a configuration option though I really think this is almost always unexpected behavior I could send a pull request but I do not have an appropriate dev environment set up and so would have to do so without testing which makes me nervous I can not actually find where Signal is calling out to the browser

column2: Fix Redphone race conditions
column3: Fixes 4172 The debug log shows that CallManager terminate can be called by the user before the thread has run and the signalManager was initialized It is then still initialized later but thus never properly terminated That is fixed in the first commit During termination I noticed that for example network failures will still trigger a failure sound even if the user meanwhile ended the call The second commit of this PR fixes that the call screen will now stay visible until RedPhoneService has fully terminated Since the bug can still be caused intentionally the time that a call can ring should be limited Phone companies do that as well See fourth commit I recommend to check the commits separately and suppress white space changes

column2: Record and send audio software walkie talkie for using in bad connectivity conditions
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Enhancement description There are many sharing options in Signal including sending of images and videos taken from camera or audio files recorded by another application but there is no convenient way to send and receive play in app audio recordings recorded only with the microphone This is a very useful feature in bad connectivity or harsh audio environments where live audio call is not an option a very notable case being a warzone or aftermath of a natural disaster There are also many markets such as Spain where people use this function on a daily basis If the description is not evident enough try to think of it as a software walkie talkie which allows the first Signal user to only press a button in the application like push to talk button on a walkie talkie and it starts recording the audio which is then compressed with a suitable speech codec and sent via Signal to the receiving user In this way the talk is not real time but it allows for disturbances in the connectivity between the two users and it also allows the second user to listen to the message repeatedly in case of loud audio environment on any side of the conversation ps Maybe TextSecure Server would be a better repository to post this enhancement to but it does not seem too live and I have not been able to found the Signal Server one If it is necessary I will repost this elsewhere just let me know where

column2: fallback to a different SMS provider than builtin SMS carrier
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Since I do not have a phone carrier plan I use signal to send and receive messages over Wifi connections This works because I have a VoIP provider with which I was able to go through the voice based registration procedure and thank you so much for that However to send and receive SMS messages I use a different app which works pretty well In fact during the registration process I did receive the SMS confirmation message i just was not able to use it because Signal did not intercept it But that is fine as well because I could work around the problem My main concern at this point is that I need to consciously switch between my SMS and Signal apps based on whether or not I know that the user has Signal at all In fact I think there is a usability issue there even for regular user if Signal has trouble sending SMS messages e g problem with the SIM card connectivity issues how does it tell the user From my point of view here Signal tries to send the message and I get the bouncing 3 dots forever even though there is no SIM card on the phone and this will never succeed What I would like would be for Signal to be able to talk to other apps to send and receive insecure SMS messages I am not sure i clearly understand how the insecure fallback works right now it does not feel like Signal uses the builtin messaging app but talks to the SMS subsystem of Android on itself Could it be possible to fallback to some other SMS provider I guess this also applies to competing protocols like Whatsapp or Telegram what if my contact is not using signal Could I still use Signal as a unified messaging app and coincidentally invite my poor Whatsapp or Telegram user to join Signal Note that other apps would need support for such process of course I have opened an issue for my specific app but I guess there would need to be such systems in place for this to work with Telegram or Whatsapp or whatever Finally I understand if you close my feature request as out of scope but please do consider at least the case where the sim card is misplaced removed or the phone is in airplane mode Usability could be improved at that level At least having a timeout or a shorter one if there is one already would improve the situation here Steps to reproduce remove your SIM card register a SIP account with SMS support e g at install an app to manage SMS in Android e g try to send an insecure message in Signal Actual result the message never gets sent and gets stuck in the bouncing 3 dots state forever or at least I have a few messages stuck in that state since saturday so 48h Expected result detect there is no SIM card and fail or offer some configuration option to send messages through another messaging app Screenshots screenshot 2016 04 04 14 36 44 The above screenshot shows Signal functioning normally for secure messages but shows the last message stuck in the three bouncing dots state for 3 minutes Earlier in the history there are two more messages stuck in that state from saturday not shown in screenshot Device info replace the examples with your info Device HTC One S4 Ville Android version 5 1 1 Cyanogenmod 12 1 20160323 NIGHTLY Ville Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log immediately after the bug has happened capture a debug log via Signal is advanced settings and paste the link below

column2: After installing Signal Desktop my Signal Android crashes on startup
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates Perhaps similar to 5173 x read Bug description Signal crashes on startup adb log attached Steps to reproduce After attempting to setup the Signal Desktop on the Chromium browser my Android Signal now crashes immediately after putting up the Passphrase prompt Tried the airplane mode article suggestion no change Rebooted cleared cache again it continues to crash Note that this was the second try at installing Signal Desktop the first one I aborted as the key generation was taking way too long 8 hrs The second try worked for the Desktop at least but the my Android started crashing I sent one crash report from the phone not sure where that goes Screenshots Likely not useful Device info Device Samsung Galaxy S4 AT T model Android version 5 0 1 Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log See attached adb log trimmed to just before and after attempting to start Signal adb txt

column2: Unable to send or recieve images from other Signal users
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Unable to send or receive images from other Signal users Attempting to send results in a Not Delivered message on the thumbnail and clicking on it shows a Failed to Send error Debug log attached of image send attempt Receiving results in a continuous loading circle loop being displayed i e I can tell that someone has attempted to send me an image but the thumbnail and image do not load Issues started occurring since I started using Signal for Desktop Desktop signal sends and receives images without issue but unlinking reinstalling and or resetting cache app data resetting secure sessions etc do not correct issue Issue occurs on both WiFi and 4G Data network both of which are otherwise operating without issue Issue has been ongoing for numerous weeks Steps to reproduce Set up signal on mobile device Set up signal for desktop Send image to other signal user 5 seconds image send fails Attempt to recieve an image from another signal user Image received notification displays Signal attempts to download image No image downloaded Actual result Thumbnails and images are not loaded and sending provides an error to the user Expected result Images send and receive correctly Screenshots signal send fail signal recieve fail Device info Device LG Google Nexus 5 hammerhead Android version 6 0 1 Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log Immediately after failed send Immediately after failed recieve

column2: Moving signal from one phone to another causes issues
column3: Bug description Last week I was travelling Prior to my trip I had asked a question on the Signal site about migrating my session to my old phone which would not matter too much if it were lost or stolen The response I got was However it does not seem to be as simple as this Steps to reproduce This explains my pre travel actions Install signal for android on phone1 Use signal for a while Partake in private and group messages Remove sim card from phone1 and install in phone2 Install signal on phone2 At this point I am on the road with phone2 If you message people they are informed that my keys have changed which is fine However if other people post in a group chat that you were involved in on phone1 then the group is named Unnamed group on phone2 and the message entry box is un tappable You see messages come in but you are unable to send messages Then I returned home and replaced the sim card into phone1 Now I cannot message anyone The messages have a red message next to them saying Failed to send and Tap for details When you tap you see i Some issues need your attention and Failed to send There is a re send button but it does not help in this case Expected Outcome Signal should work on multiple devices per account and it would be nice if it worked on tablets too I think the issues I outline are because each user is expected to have exactly one keypair This would be fine if there were a way to share a keypair between more than one device or if Signal allowed one account to have multiple key pairs Maybe this design decision relates to the fact that a phone number can be active in only one device at a time I also note that signal still works on phone1 which has no SIM card inserted Not sure if that is desired behaviour I'm not sure what I should do to get signal working again please advise Thanks

column2: Fixed crash when selecting multiple attachments
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Galaxy Nexus Android 4 4 4 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve You can also use the fixes 1234 syntax to refer to specific issues either here or in your commit message Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works Fixed the crash when selecting multiple attachments Since this is unsupported behavior in Android I did not add any additional handling just got rid of the crash FREEBIE

column2: Dark Theme suggestions
column3: I am a big fan of the dark theme so in using it I had a few thoughts about things I think would improve it I'm not savvy on all the material design guidelines from google so if I have ideas that break that you know why Here goes 1 The light theme has a blue bar on the top The dark theme is black I do not know which is more palatable but it might look pretty slick if the textsecure icon or the top bar was also blue in the dark theme 2 When there is an unread message it shows the time in blue I like the color idea but should the color match the security level i e green for SMS blue for TS messages 3 The TextSecure text at the top does not look bold like the same text in the light theme Do not know which is right but they should probably match 4 In the Settings area the checkbox for push has a sea green or aqua background which looks kinda pukey to me I would like to see it blue like in the light theme or maybe have it be black and the checkmark be blue This is in the Advanced area of Settings too 5 This one is actually in both dark and light The lock phone and option menu dots in the top right take up enough space that most if not all my contacts names are partially truncated with the ellipses Not a huge deal but is there a way to re arrange that area to show the whole name Thanks again for the effort put behind TextSecure and all the other apps you guys work on Really truly great stuff you guys are like coding gymnasts I hope these are helpful and not a waste of time

column2: Minor UX Dark theme improvements
column3: Two dark theme items 1 The TS message send arrow airplane is lighter color blue than the the text bubbles I noted there are other dark theme blue icons so this might be nice to have here 2 The background of the top bar where the TextSecure and the search magnifying glass and options dots are in the list of conversations has no color at all I think it would be a nice touch to have a blue background for that bar like the light theme does but using the darker blue

column2: Fingerprint verification State missing
column3: Setting the trusted state have to be done by the user at the moment every message is checked of in chat without the user can even know if he can trust this fingerprint Else simply checking if the fingerprints are the same is not enough The way how it is implemented yet is practically unusable If the fingerprint is altered by a man in the middle you would not know until you check it again So doing it like in OTR Saving each fingerprint and display its trusted state in Chat will be more appropriate in the meaning of feeling secure

column2: Able to receive messages from contact securely but cannot send securely
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description A contact which I have previously been communicating with via the secure data channel has suddenly only become able to send via SMS however messages and voice calls from this contact continue to be received via the data channel It appears that my device has decided that the remote user is no longer using Signal Unfortunately I was unable to capture a debug log when the changeover occurred 27 hours ago Looking back through the conversation it appears that a message failed to deliver and all further messages fell back to the SMS transport I have had the remote user restart the secure session which has no impact The only debug step I have not taken is to delete the conversation and attempt to restart it I would prefer not to do this and lose the conversation history if possible Steps to reproduce Attempt to send user a message Actual result Message delivered via SMS If message sent from desktop app a Message not sent error appears Expected result Message delivered via data channel Attempt to reset secure session using menu in conversation Actual result Invite menu option is available Expected result Reset secure session menu option is available Attempt to call user Actual result Call is made using standard dialer app Expected result Secure call is initiated Attempt to reset secure session via desktop app Actual result Message not sent alert appears Re sending causes same error Expected result Secure session reset successfully Screenshots Device info Device motorola XT1575 clark retus Android version 6 0 3 MPHS24 49 18 3 Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log Log taken just after attempting to send a message to the user

column2: A version without dependence on Google Play Services
column3: I love Signal and have used it for some time and gotten several friends to start using it But recently I switched my Motorola Nexus 6 to AOSP based CyanogenMod 13 0 1 Android 6 0 1 r17 and I do not want to install any Google compiled proprietary software on it I see that when I try to install a Signal 3 15 2 apk from APK Mirror it does install and starts But when I get to the first screen Connect with Signal where it is asking me for verification of my phone number so that it can register me and I press the Register button it then pops up a white message box saying Get Google Play services Signal wo not run without Google Play services which are missing from your phone And gives me a link which does not work no doubt to the Google Play Store to GET GOOGLE PLAY SERVICES Might it be possible to have a version of Signal without this dependency on having Google Play services installed Thanks

column2: feature Add the ability to retract messages
column3: Hi I would like to start a discussion regarding adding the ability for Signal to retract messages sent I propose that a user who sends messages retains the ability to delete a message that will also be deleted on the message recipients devices Both parties should see that the message was retracted but not the content anymore

column2: LED notification does not work
column3: I have run into a weird little issue my phone is LED indicator is not working as part of new message notifications The sound and the vibration do work but the LED does not which results in very poor usability since without the blinking LED having missed the initial sounds and vibrations there is then no way to tell by just looking at the phone whether or not there are new messages except by unlocking the screen so in order to not miss messages one has to constantly unlock the screen and check for a notification in the status bar The LED used to work fine with text messages prior to the installation of Signal It still works correctly with WhatsApp Signal seems to be the only app where the LED is malfunctioning Here is my debug log I submitted this issue as a support request ID 1667 back on December 13 but have since despaired of getting any reply and so decided to create an issue here

column2: Sent videos should not take up extra space on internal memory
column3: Ever since I installed Android M on my Moto G3 I have had problems not filling my internal memory by accident because Play Music now refuses to put my music on my SD card Ordinarily I can handle this quite well with one exception Signal keeps using all the internal space because everytime I send a video the app creates a duplicate of the file inside of Signal and I can not help but ask Why Why would I ever need a copy of my video inside of Signal If you send a video you already have it on your phone so why make another copy The obvious explanation is that that way you know which video you sent but really can not you just add a file name instead I think this behavior would be fine if I could put Signal on my SD card or if Signal could somehow only save transferred files on the SD card but in a world where internal space is scarce I think this is a really stupid design decision Yes I know about the feature that trims conversations and yes I know I can just delete the video from Signal after sending the file But come on guys that should not be necessary

column2: Group conversation bugs
column3: There are some bugs in group conversations when following these steps Two parties 1 and 2 1 1 disables Textsecure messages in settings 2 2 creates a group conversation and invites 1 3 1 enables Textsecure messages in settings 4 2 sends a message in the group conversation This scenario resulted in four found bugs The first message that is sent by 2 in step 4 is not received by 1 When a message is successfully transmitted the group thread appears in 1 chat list But it does not have the selected thread name It uses Unnamed group Pressing the show members icon will not display any members Major problem 1 can not open the keyboard Pressing the emoji icon will open the emoji drawer but it is not possible to press send Attaching a file is also possible but it is not possible to press end Device info Samsung Galaxy S5 Android 5 0 Textsecure 2 26 2 Sony Z3 Compact Android 5 1 1 Textsecure 2 25 3 App state Push registered Enable Disable Textsecure messages Log Related issues I am investigating what causes this problem Would appreciate any comments advice specially on the 4th bug

column2: Enhancement Only open keyboard in contact list when long pressing the Compose button
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read I have always found it unnerving that the keyboard always pops up when opening the contact list and I'm sure I'm not the only one Nine out of ten times I will immediately close the keyboard At the same time I understand that this behavior has its purpose So in order to make everybody happy I suggest a small but quite elegant imho change that additionally is completely in line with Android is i e Marshmallow is own behavior regarding e g the All Apps button the button that opens Android is app drawer Tapping the Compose i e pencil button opens the contact list but not the keyboard Long pressing the Compose button opens the contact list AND the keyboard Ok that is it My suggestion

column2: Invasive invite banner
column3: I have x a useful feedback x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description It is worst than a spam even with an ablocker you can not get rid of it it is the invite banner in text mode This is not a feature it is reductive I have seen people losing 1 5 of their screen because they are too lazy to click on that small cross and the banner stay forever It make sense it is a nice maybe cool way to advertise the product but it is invasive Steps to reproduce download the app text a non signal friends endure a smaller screen for your 100 text messaging Actual result invasive banner Expected result no banner A option to invite friends after registering for the first time would be nice Or an option in the menu

column2: RedPhone server source code
column3: moxie0 Could you please release RedPhone server source code You could release it under the AGPL license so everybody who wants to run a modified of the RedPhone server would have to open source the changes You can read more here After reading your replies on the list I understand that the main reason for not releasing it is that you do not want to be flooded with support questions Now that you have an unofficial support forum you could just redirect support questions there Are there any other reasons for not releasing RedPhone server source code I had already asked this question on the mailing list but I have not received any official reply That is why I'm opening an issue here

column2: Allow manual selection between SMS and Signal messages feature request
column3: There were a lot of cases for this already After looking through conversations it seems that each of them references others as duplicates and so all of them are considered closed I have a person in my contact list who is mostly offline but this person is Signal user I am also Signal user ans I also often get offline When I send message to this person it stays undelivered for hours In case when it is urgent but not confidential at all I want to have an ability to send it as SMS explicitly I can just use built in SMS application to send and receive SMS as I am going to do now but it is more comfortable and safe to use Signal here too So the only wish is to let me decide when talking to Signal users what exactly I want to send Signal message or SMS Finally until Signal allows to select between its messages and SMS replacing stock SMS app with Signal just looks confusing because of above reasons

column2: Can only send unsecured SMS
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description I can only send unsecured sms to someone that has the Signal app And once I install the Chrome app I can send him Signal messages in a secure way and they show up with lock and everything in the Android app Steps to reproduce This is more like a default s Install the Signal app User was not in list of possible persons contact Searched by phone number Open conversation with user Actual result Can only send unsecured sms Expected result Can send secured Signal message Things I already tried to fix it Force stop in Android settings Clear data in Android settings Screenshots Ca not make one because of app security measures Device info replace the examples with your info Device Google Nexus 5 Android version 6 0 1 Security patch level April 2 2016 Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log

column2: Send using Enter Key on Hardware Keyboard
column3: Feature request when using an external USB keyboard with my device on Signal make it possible to send messages using either kbd Enter kbd kbd Ctrl kbd kbd Enter kbd kbd Shift kbd kbd Enter kbd If desired to send on plain kbd Enter kbd kbd Shift kbd kbd Enter kbd should enter a newline

column2: Messages not sent
column3: Since about a week ago very often the messages I send get stuck on the wavering dots stage which I presume means not even sent let alone delivered Today I tried reinstalling and now the contact list does not get populated one contact sent me a message and so showed up but that is it

column2: Read notifications
column3: I would like to have Signal display read notifications to contacts that I choose I have read the lengthy discussion in 957 about read receipts but since this is over 2 years old I would like to reopen the discussion From my point of view having a feature that transmits information like when a message was read in an app that is about communication i e the transmission of information is a good thing Whether to make this feature on off by default or opt in opt out is obviously debatable My personal opinion is that I would probably like it to be opt out on a per contact basis but to not change the current behavior for people from how it currently is it would probably be more sensible to have Signal ask the question once per contact when you start a new conversation unless a default setting is set in the settings section Even if the feature is delivered as off by default and has to be manually enabled it would be a big improvement over the status quo Because and I cannot stress this enough after reading through the discussion in 957 having a minority restrict the choices of a majority is the opposite of freedom and democracy and it seems to me these are among the most important things that free secure messaging is trying to protect

column2: Failure sending receiving images
column3: People in my contact list report that they are unable to send and receive images The delivery just fails This occurs both in groups and with single recipients

column2: Unable to send pictures mms through signal app

questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing I am attempting to send a picture within an column2: Add some sort of ability for signal to track which peer is keys are verified
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature description Right now if I do the QR code dance and verify that my peer is who I think they are there is no UI element which indicates that that this has happened As a result I have some contacts who I forget we have verified keys and so we do it a second time This is not harmful it is just stupid on my behalf If I'm the kind of person who cares about verifying keys which is rare I grant this could also make it easy for me to see whose keys I have not verified yet

column2: Two tiny tweaks to Dockerfile so it builds
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines I have tested my contribution on these devices Device A Android X Y Z Device B Android Z Y Virtual device W Android Y Y Z x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve You can also use the fixes 1234 syntax to refer to specific issues either here or in your commit message Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works In the Dockerfile changed the openjdk 8 jdk 8u72 b15 1 trusty1 to openjdk 8 jdk and removed the unzipping of whatever used to be at ANDROID HOME temp zip because there is nothing there now I tested by running a shell in the resulting container cloning this repo therein and running gradlew build successfully FREEBIE

column2: Redphone Phone encrypted calls not for all contacts
column3: Android 6 0 1 Nexus 5 Signal version 3 15 2 I have a few contacts maybe 5 of all my Signal partners where I am able to send encrypted messages to but this lock sign next to the earphone symbol is missing indicating unsecure unencrypted regular calls only The phone number syntax is the same across all contacts removing the account and refreshing things does not help for testing purposes I tried new different phone number layouts prefix vs sign etc etc with no improvement The funny thing is that with those 5 the other contacts do see this lock sign with my contact and they can successfully inititate Redphone calls to me It is just my side which cannot initiate encrypted calls So what is wrong with this 5 of my Signal contacts Any help is welcome Kind regards mistersixt

column2: Signal is my default SMS app but incoming messages are routed to Hangouts
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description I have set Signal as my default SMS app It sends messages fine and launches when I click the message icon from my contact list Signal does not however receive SMS messages SMS messages sent to me are routed through hangouts This happens even though Signal is recognized as the default SMS app and Settings Apps Hangouts Permissions SMS is toggled off Toggling Wifi Calling support in settings does not seem to make a difference This looks similar to what was happening to what was happening to user espinozagabe in issue 5033 He was told to post his case to a new issue but I could not find it Steps to reproduce Install Signal Set Signal as the default SMS app Send messages it will work fine Actual result When people respond to the messages sent with Signal they are routed to Hangouts Expected result Incoming messages should go to Signal since it is the default SMS app Screenshots you can drag and drop images below Device info replace the examples with your info Device LGE Nexus 5X on Project Fi Android version 6 0 1 Signal version 3 15 2

column2: Project Fi not receiving SMS messages through Signal when set as default app
column3: Issue is in the Title I apologize ahead if time if there is another thread with this issue Open I searched and could not find one I have a Nexus 6 running Android 6 0 1 on Signal Version 3 9 1 I use Project Fi as a carrier here is the debug log Let me know if there is anything else I can do to help

column2: Feature request Support offline mesh network messaging
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Feature Request Offline mesh network messaging Implement an option to use an offline mesh message network like e g firechat firechat and the like use the phones Wi Fi and Bluetooth antennas to transmit messages calls and files without connection to cell towers or Wi Fi if more people are using it it can relay messages through other users to the recipient less server load it could be nice if signal could send messages like is local mesh network available yes use no is signal message possible ues use no use sms Why usercase1 privacy This will give great privacy reassurance if you are within range to use a local mesh network you can communicate offline with less chance of mass surveillance Firechat was used for this reason during the umbrella revolution in Hong Kong for democracy and free speach usercase2 travel mass gatherings If you are travelling to a country where you do not have a mobile plan or in a place without coverage plane or underground train you can use local mesh network messaging to contact people and to find people in the crowd of a festival etc This would give great convenience privacy communication redundancy and save on you money on your mobile plan

column2: Extend DPAD support
column3: This pull request is built upon the previous 3585 What this pull request adds Allows the following to be selected interacted with and visably indicated Conversations Individual messages Contacts Selection of the Reminder UI element also interaction of the Reminder X cancel button Interaction with Resend button Left to jump to reminder notices Right to jump to FAB or compose input while in a list Control of the Country UI element in the registration screen Notes Default to focus on Resend button on send error screen Focus sink on error list item only on some Android versions 4 0 4 cannot navigate away which means cannot actually select resend button Other Android versions can focus away from the list item but cannot select the actual Resend button Default focus to address this problem Focus is set in code might also be possible to set request focus in XML but could not manage to cause a send fail manually to test While selection of Reminder alerts are possible DPAD CENTER does not actually perform the action Do not know how to make this happen DPAD CENTER on the X cancel button works however The following are things that I could not figure out how to allow for hardware keypad to control these items Cannot select the tick box in the upper left to accept members to add to a group can mark their checkboxes though Cannot select the X remove button to remove someone from group Cannot navigate pop up Menu New group Mark all read Invite friends Import export etc that menu Cannot select use the Attachment or camera acquire UI elements

column2: Links wo not open in new tabs
column3: Since version 3 7 2 it is impossible to open multiple links from a conversation in separate browser tabs as every link will be opened in the same tab and so overwrite the previously opened link I am using Firefox for Android It does not seem to be a Firefox bug as with other apps the browser behaves as expected it is opening a new tab for every link

column2: Override startActivity to add CREATE NEW TAB extra
column3: Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines x I have tested my contribution on these devices Nexus 5 hammerhead Android 4 4 4 Cyanogenmod 11 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve You can also use the fixes 1234 syntax to refer to specific issues either here or in your commit message Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works The TextView uses the URLSpan onClick to create the intent when a user clicks on Linkified URLs with an extra of Browser EXTRA APPLICATION ID This results in the browser window being re used for any future URLs By overriding onClick in the Activity and adding Browser EXTRA CREATE NEW TAB to any Browser requests we prevent the window re use Further reading Fixes 4874 Fixes 5356 Tested by making sure links open new windows in Chrome and ensured consistent behavior of telephone numbers email addresses plain text and long presses

column2: Selecting multiple attachments to send crashes the app
column3: mark with x between the I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description If I want to send someone more than one image at once I know that is not implemented 4629 but selecting them is possible with e g Amaze File Manager or any other file managing app I guess Signal crashes As far as I investigated there is no difference between a Signal contact and an SMS contact Tested it with images and audio files Steps to reproduce Press the attachment button and select image Choose your favorite file managing app for the action I used Amaze File Manager Select multiple images and click select Crash Device info Model Fairphone 1U Android version 4 2 2 Signal version 3 11 1 Edit Added debug log

column2: update documentation
column3: I have noticed that many wiki pages need an update and or are missing For examle the aredphone protocol' page is not reachable since the github repo was taken down Another thing i noticed is the protocol is still called textsecure protocol v2 Since this is the only protocol signal has ever supported i suggest we just call it the signal protocol this is kind of off topic but is why I was looking for the wiki page how much is shared between the messaging and calling protocols Is the calling protocol zrtp as claimed here If this is true it means it does not have the self healing properties of the axolotl ratchet right

column2: Messages delivery receipts are slow to deliver
column3: I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read For some reason all messages delivered through Signal are slow to deliver I say this based on the checkmark sent delivered indicator but also based on manually talking to a contact to figure out when things came through I find that when this happens asking the other person to send me a Signal message will force all undelivered messages to go through In this case calling through Signal does not work it is just stuck at dialing forever although it is possible though unlikely that I just did not wait long enough However once pending messages are flushed calling starts working again This happens both on Signal Android and a linked Signal Desktop I have also seen it happen when contacting contacts on both Android and iOS At least one of the contacts I have seen this with has been on Signal for months and at least one contact I have seen this with had literally just installed and registered When this does not happen I find that messages will sometimes take a couple seconds to go through but before I started running into this issue which was a week or two ago messages would generally go through almost instantly All contacts that I'm sending messages to are in the same geographic area so in theory we should all be contacting the same server region in case there servers run in e g multiple AWS regions Device info Device Nexus 6P Android version CyanogenMod 13 0 20160604 NIGHTLY angler based on Android 6 0 1 Signal version 3 16 0 installed via the Google Play Store gapps was installed via the OpenGApps nano package I'm on Play Store 6 5 08 D all 0 2792142 Google Play Services 9 0 83 440 121911109 The problem seems to occur regardless of whether or not I'm on a WiFi network I called my contact over the cell network he was on WiFi while I was seeing the issue and said that both my test messages went through when he disconnected although I only saw a delivery receipt on one of them possibly a different bug Link to debug log

column2: Workaround to add tsdevice string when QR codes wo not work
column3: You can remove this first section if you have contributed before First time contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I have read how to contribute to this project x I have signed the Contributor Licence Agreement Contributor checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly x I am following the Code Style Guidelines To the best of my knowledge grimacing x I have tested my contribution on these devices LG Nexus 5 Android 4 4 4 Samsung Galaxy S3 Replicant Android 4 2 2 x My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is x I have made the choice whether I want the BitHub reward or not by omitting or adding the word FREEBIE in my commit message Description Describe briefly what your pull request proposes to fix Especially if you have more than one commit it is helpful to give a summary of what your contribution as a whole is trying to solve You can also use the fixes 1234 syntax to refer to specific issues either here or in your commit message Also please describe shortly how you tested that your fix actually works So I do not know if this is mergeable for UX philosophical reasons so Moxie you will have to make that call but I thought since I had already written the code as a jank hack just to get Signal Desktop to pair with my personal device I thought I would offer it as a potential solution to 4637 This commit adds an EditText and Button that will allow a user to manually type the QR code text tsdevice blahblahblah into the EditText and then submit the device that way The UX for this may not be optimal and I ended up using an setOnFocusChangeListener on the EditText because it makes it a nightmare to type because the soft keyboard and screen takes too much space while you are trying to type if you do not hide the camera preview I have tested this on two devices with two separate phone numbers and it allowed me to pair signal desktop to the device both times Here is a screenshot screen Thanks

column2: Please consider supporting Firefox
column3: Signal is an open source application meant to protect users' privacy Firefox is an open source browser with privacy as one of its main goals It does not feel right to use Signal on Chrome a closed source browser Please consider supporting Firefox

column2: Remote Deletion of my sent messages on other chat partners devices AKA kill switch for messages
column3: Feature suggestion Remote Deletion of my sent messages on other chat partners devices AKA kill switch for messages that I wrote Current Situation Android can limit to e g 50 messages older messages get deleted automatically need to define this for all chat partners individually Feature Suggestion Variant A I can set the Remote limit of my messages to automatically cut off after 50 messages in MY chat with the other chat partner on THEIR devices kill older messages than 50 Variant B Remote Delete my sent messages on other chat partners devices kill my messages Reason I want to keep control of my messages of my lines that I sent after I sent them

column2: Message not delivered until the phone is unlocked
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description I'm using Signal on a Sony Xperia M2 and it works perfectly My sister just installed Signal on her Sony Xperia M4 a few days ago but when we are sending messages to each other the message does not deliver until we unlock our Android phones Is there something we can do to avoid that It is very annoying and I have to unlock my phone every 30 minutes or so to be sure that my sister has not sent me a message And she has the exact same problem Steps to reproduce I send her a message or she sends me a message with the Android Signal app Actual result I do not receive the messages that my sister sends me with the Android Signal application when my phone is locked I have to unlock my phone to receive her messages And she has the same problem when I send her a message Expected result I should receive her messages without having to unlock my phone like you normally receive messages on a phone Device info Device Sony Xperia M2 for me and Sony Xperia M4 for my sister Android version 4 4 4 Signal version 3 16 0 Link to debug log There is no debug log

column2: Signal asks for access to everything
column3: This is a credibility issue I try to get everyone to use Signal but twice in a row now when I try to get Android users i have iOS to do it they are fine until Signal requires access to everything Then I look like a liar a dummy or both For example why does Signal need access to the calendar Just because it is open source is not enough for many people to trust it if their phone tells them it wants to see everything Is there a way to let users opt out of some features so they can decide what the appropriate level of access is

column2: Provider reusing old phone number leads to some fun
column3: Changing phone number after verifying old phone number can lead to interesting stuff if provider decides to reuse old phone number NOTE This might not be an issue with app or might not be an issue at all but something to keep in mind or maybe it is known quick google returned nothing similar Or maybe something can be done with protocol or by making app verify SIM card phone number did not change No idea Just putting this here Steps to reproduce 1 Register and verify current phone number with signal 2 Change phone number get new sim card in my case 2 1 Forget to register and verify your new phone number with signal because it still works I still get messages from my signal contacts 3 Get old phone number blocked and reused by provider someone else now has your old phone number I think this could be easily reproduced without providers reusing your phone number and just putting sim card into some other phone TO RESEARCH what would happen if new owner of my old phone number also registered that phone number with signal Would I receive his her messages assuming I did not change my signal phone number Actual result Other people can still send SMS to you by using your old phone number while using signal Using not signal to send messages sends them to person who now has your old phone number Calling them via signal icon was of not encrypted call calls new owner of your old phone number awkward conversation Expected result No idea Check if user has not changed their phone number to prevent such fun incidents

column2: Sending regular SMS to a Signal user
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description I can not send a regular SMS to a contact with whom I normally use Signal This is sometimes necessary if a contact exhausted their data plan for example The only workaround I have found is to make the regular SMS app the default app send the message then set the default back to Signal Steps to reproduce Make sure Signal is the default app for SMS Look up the contact in the address book Click in the message icon next to the number Compose a message Actual result Message is sent through the Signal protocok and there is no way to change that behaviour The contact does not get it if they do not have an internet connection on their device Expected result There would be a way to switch temporarily to regular messages for the contact Not sure of the exact optimal behaviour in terms of UX but it should be technically possible to send an SMS

column2: JPG image from MMS saved in database with wrong header
column3: This is a bug report template By following the instructions below and filling out the sections with your information you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue You can also preview your report before submitting it You may remove sections that are not relevant to your particular case Before we begin please note that this tracker is only for issues not questions or comments If you are looking for support please see our support center instead or email support whispersystems org Let is begin with a checklist replace the empty checkboxes below with checked ones x accordingly I have X searched open and closed issues for duplicates X read Bug description I'm unable to view a received MMS The thumbnail is badged with a red error triangle and is just blank when I click on it When I try saving the image I get a corrupt jpg file which cannot be viewed The logs say its due to the thumbnail having illegal dimensions org thoughtcrime securesms util BitmapDecodingException Failed to decode image dimensions 1 1 After analyzing the image file it appears that the first two bytes of the image file which should be FF D8 the JPEG start of image marker is instead 5C 52 the ascii string R After modifying on my desktoip a manually saved copy of the file changing the first two bytes to the correct values the image displayed correctly Device info replace the examples with your info Device samsung SM N910F trltexx Android version 5 1 1 Signal version 3 15 2 Link to debug log

column2: Suggestion about how SMS should be handled with signal users
column3: I think it should be made more clear that SMS is possible with signal contacts as it is not immediately obvious that you have to hold down the send button There are a few annoying edge cases that come up when a user does not have an internet connection One is that signal does not remember that it is sending a message If you consider another platform like WhatsApp if there is not an internet connection the app keeps trying to send it until it succeeds With signal if a user sends a message and forgets about it it wo not be sent even when an internet connection becomes available again Another solution is to transition to SMS when there is not a connection Obviously a seamless transition brings forth security concerns but a warning message alerting the user that a connection is not available and then asking if they would like to send an insecure SMS message instead could work The app would display the messages differently and ask again after n minutes

column2: Delivery confirmation not carrying over from Signal Desktop to Android in group chats
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description The second checkmark that should be displayed when a message is delivered to the recipients does not show up on Signal for Android when the message is sent from Signal for Desktop The message itself shows up but not the delivery confirmation Messages sent from Android do show up as confirmed delivered on the desktop so I believe this is an issue with the Android version This bug only happens in a group chat private messages do not encounter this problem This bug makes it hard to keep track of what has been delivered and what has not I have confirmed that all of the messages in the screenshots were delivered by talking to the recipients in person Steps to reproduce Connect Signal on Android and desktop Send a message from the desktop version to a group chat Check the conversation on Android Actual result Messages do not show delivery confirmation on Android but do show it on desktop Expected result Messages show up as delivered on both Screenshots The messages sent in this first set of screenshots were sent from my desktop Notice that the delivery confirmation is missing in the Android version screenshot1 img src width 400 As a comparison these messages were sent from my Android The delivery confirmation does transfer to my desktop screenshot2 img src width 400 Device info Device Motorola Nexus 6 Windows Desktop Android version CyanogenMod 13 Android 6 0 1 Signal version 3 16 0 Android 0 16 1 Desktop Link to debug log

column2: Feature Delete encrypted database with deletion passphrase
column3: I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Currently it is possible to retry and to guess the passphrase for an encrypted database In case a person is enforced to reveal the data after some time and multiple threats one may decide to use the correct passphrase and the data gets decrypted although it may contain sensible information It might be useful to be able to set a deletion passphrase which causes creates an empty new database or a sane version with some dummy messages and deletes the actual messages Steps to reproduce This is not a bug report but a features request Actual result Describe here what happens after you run the steps above i e the buggy behaviour The feature does not exist yet Expected result Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above i e what would be the correct behaviour Ideal steps In Settings privacy in case a passphrase is set provide a field set deletion passphrase It should not be visible if such a passphrase is enabled Old ones may not be overwritten If this passphrase is entered to access signal all data shall be deleted Screenshots Device info Link to debug log Concerns Professionals who know about this feature would first backup all data so this feature wo not provide full security of the data It is assumed that in most cases the technical competence and knowledge about app specifics of enforcement is limited

column2: Need protection against SMS interception by hostile carrier
column3: Telegram has recently been involved in a government led hack that exposed many of their Iranian customers The problem is that the carrier intercepted the activation SMS and set up new devices for one is account Signal seems to have the same vulnerability maybe worse since there does not seem to be a way to add a password to an account which Telegram has There should be a way to better protect users in countries where the government and the carrier cannot be trusted

column2: Limit contact access to user chosen contact group
column3: I would prefer not to share my Signal availability to all my contacts but rather to a contact group I can select I recognize this is perhaps a niche request I would also be helped with pointers how I can program this myself in a private build I have contacted support whispersystems org and they said they could not help me so it looks like that channel is not the right path for feature requests or tips on how to get into the code base I have x searched open and closed issues for duplicates x read Bug description Signal uses all my system contacts when looking for people to contact sending the list of number hashes to the signal servers for discovery I would prefer not to announce my usage of Signal to everyone in my contacts list but rather to a specific contact group Steps to reproduce Sign up for Signal All my system contacts are notified I use Signal Actual result All my system contacts get notified I use Signal if they also have Signal installed Expected result Only those contacts which are in a special selected group Let is say Signal should get that notification
